description: Switzerland January 27, Ticino invites citizens who travelled to China in the last 14 days and who demonstrate respiratory problems and/or fever to avoid presenting themselves in health facilities but to contact their family doctor only by telephone, or the Rescue Center 144 or the emergency medical service.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: Switzerland: From January 27, 2020, doctors and laboratories will have to report cases of suspected corona infection to the cantons and the federal government within two hours, as FOPH media spokesman Jonas Montani confirmed in a report by "Sonntagsblick" to the Keystone-SDA news agency.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On its press conference on February 25, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health informed about the first person in Switzerland confirmed as being infected with the new coronavirus 2019-nCoV. People in close contact with the individual are being notified and placed in quarantine and their condition will be monitored over the next 14 days. On its webside ( February 16) the FOPH informed:" Should there be cases, the sick people would be isolated. Close Contact persons would have to be in quarantine for two weeks." On the webside for health professionals ( Feb 17) the term close contact is specified:
Contact from less than 2 meters and for more than 15 minutes. People who live in the same household. Care or medical examination without protective gear. Direct contact with body fluids. The cantonal departements of Health (Kantonsarzt) are responsible for tracing contact persons and monitoring their condition.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Swiss Canton Grisons implements contact tracing with the first confirmed cases on February 27. It is not announced as official policy but since that moment systematically used and implemented.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On February 28th, the Jura canton in Switzerland called onto individuals with flu-like symptoms and having visited risk regions (China, Iran, South Korea, Singapore and the Lombardy, Piedmont, Veneto regions of Italy) to contact their doctor and/or the hotline provided by the government. It warned against calling and going to the Emergency Services of the Jura hospitals.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: Since the first case was confirmed in Canton Zug on 3 March, contact tracing has been a fundamental part of the control measures. This will be a key strategy for the future, too.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: Since the first case was confirmed in Canton Zug on 3 March, contact tracing has been a fundamental part of the control measures. This will be a key strategy for the future, too. UPDATE: Due to the decrease in new infections with the coronavirus, contact tracing is to be carried out again consistently throughout Switzerland. The Canton of Zug, in cooperation with the Lung League of Central Switzerland, has already established daily contact with all infected persons and the close contact persons and will intensify these efforts. Comprehensive contact tracing is a recognised means of identifying and interrupting chains of infection.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: Beginning on March 5, all visitors to elderly care homes in the Swiss canton of Schwyz will be subject to checks.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
From 13th March 2020 on, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel has been monitoring the health of patients suspected of Covid-19 if they were sent back home by the coronavirus triage centers. The centers' personnel regularly monitors the evolution of the symptoms of each individual through phone calls.

NB: as a reminder, the triage centers decide whether suspect patients should be sent to the hospital or back home, and if they should get tested or not.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On March 27th, 2020, it was announced that the cantons of Appenzell Innerrhoden and Appenzell Ausserrhoden, Switzerland, have established a new medical hotline to use by people who show symptoms of Covid-19 and who wish to be tested in testing facilities in the two cantons.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: The canton of Appenzell Innerrhoden, Switzerland, has announced that starting from March 28th, 2020, there will be a new test facility for suspected Covid-19 cases placed in front of the Hospital Appenzell which will determine whether patients are to be hospitalized or not.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: The Canton of Zug is using contact tracing of COVID-19 positive patients and regular checkups with individuals self-isolating with symptoms on March 31st 2020 to map the spread of the virus.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: The canton Zurich (Switzerland) starts a "society monitoring Covid-19" process on March 31.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
Switzerland, Geneva--The canton of Geneva, in relationship with the Directorate of General Health, announced April 1 that they have developed at 3 tier patient contact and monitoring system. The three-part system is comprised of CoviCall, CoviCheck, and CoviCare. 

CoviCall is for symptomatic individuals to get direction on whether to stay home, go see a doctor, go to a sampling/monitoring site, or go to the hospital.
CoviCheck centralizes all the positive results transmitted by the laboratories.
CoviCare is an outpatient monitoring network for suspected and confirmed cases.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On 27th April 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchtel decided to start contact tracing people who tested positive for Covid-19. Cantonal authorities will contact people who tested positive and identify potential contacts who could be at risk. This policy is supervised by the cantonal doctor and it will be implemented from 29th April 2020 on. The police will participate in this contact tracing scheme.

description: On May 7, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg started using a tracking system by the WHO in order to trace and monitor the contacts of persons with a positive COVID-19 test result. These persons will then be notified and be checked upon after 5-10 days. The estimate expects approximately 8 contact persons per tested individual and has a capacity of 10 persons to be tracked per day.

description: Switzerland, the canton Glarus uses contact tracing again from May 11, 2020 onwards. With the contact tracing it will be possible to track persons who were in contact with a infectious person, the cantonal authorities.

description: In Switzerland, the canton Aargau will launch a contact tracing centre on May 11 for the accompaniment and care of people in self-isolation and self-quarantine. The infected people and their closest contest have to stay home and will be briefed, taken care of and supervised by the contact tracing centre.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
In Switzerland, in the canton Aargau the Cantonal Medical Service of Aargau offers from the 11th of May on a comprehensive service package to people who have recently become infected with COVID-19. These people will be contacted, advised and instructed individually. This service is provided by a new competence and coordination center of the cantonal medical service, the CONTI.

The exchange of information and data takes place primarily by telephone. Patients and healthcare institutions such as doctors or test laboratories can also enter their data electronically using an appropriate secure web form
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: As announced on May 11, the Swiss canton of Solothurn will resume contact tracing for all known cases of COVID-19. For this purpose, authorities have purchased a special software, as well as deployed a team of 5 people, with 10 more available if needed.

description: The canton of Zurich, Switzerland, expands contact tracing as announced on May 8th, 2020: From May 11, a new contact tracing team with 25 people begins work from their headquarters at Zurich airport. They will contact Covid-19 infected people and their contacts.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
On May 11, the Swiss Canton Grisons announces that a team from the Health Department, supported by medical professionals and members of civil protection, resumed work on contact tracing. The aim is to interrupt the chain of infection by recording the sick and their contact persons and putting them in isolation (sick) or quarantine (contact). The COVID Care Team of the Graubnden Health Department accompanies the affected people during this time. 

The Swiss Canton Grisons never officially announced contact tracing as policy. However, since the first confirmed cases, it was systematically implemented and used. After around two weeks this was not possible anymore and the "extraordinary" situation and respective measures were implemented on March 13. UPDATE: The Swiss Canton Grisons never officially announced contact tracing as policy. However, since the first confirmed cases, it was systematically implemented and used. Since the beginning of March (roughly March 8) this was not possible anymore and the "extraordinary" situation and respective measures were implemented on March 13. On May 11, contact tracing and the piloting of an app was officially announced in line with federal requirements regarding the re-opening.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: Valais (Switzerland) announces on May 14, that 4 people are conducting 7 to 10 contact tracing investigations a day. If necessary, the personal capacity can be increased to 20 people.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
On May 8, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council announced to issue a temporary ordinance (amended May 14) for the pilot phase of a mobile application (proximity tracing app) that informs its users when they have been around infected people for too long. 
The app is expected to be tested by employees of the Swiss Federal Institutes of Technology in Lausanne and Zurich, by members of the armed forces and employees of hospitals as well as the federal and cantonal administrations. 
The parliament decided this week (May 5) that a legal basis must be created before the launch of the App. To this end, the Federal Council will amend the Epidemics Act accordingly and submit an urgent message to be adopted by parliament
The app is designed to help break chains of infection. With the app, potentially infected people can be warned at an early stage and the spread of the virus can be contained without compromising their privacy. Use of the app is voluntary. No personal data or location details of the app users are used. All data in the app are continuously deleted after 21 days. The app should only be used in the containment phase.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Justice,Military,Provincial/State Government

description:
At its meeting on June 24th, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council adopted the Ordinance on the Proximity Tracing System for the Coronavirus. 
This means that the SwissCovid app can be used throughout Switzerland from June 25th.
The Federal Council recommends that the public use the app, which complements classic contact tracing. 
If an app user has been in close contact with one or more infected individuals, they receive a message telling them that they may be infected with the new coronavirus. They are also notified of the day on which the contact took place along with details of the FOPH Infoline that they can call free of charge to obtain advice.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Justice

description:
In Switzerland the state of emergency ended at the 19th of June, since then the the crisis management is carried out by the the cantonal medical service responsible in accordance with the Epidemics Act or the Department of Health and Social Affairs. They will adopt and implement the cantonal instructions and measures necessary to prevent further virus spread. As a first step, the canton of Aargau will introduce an ID for bar and club visits from Friday, July 3, 2020, 6 p.m.
For this purpose, the canton of Aargau is introducing an ID requirement for visits to bars and clubs. The general decree will come into effect on Friday, July 3, 2020, at 6 p.m.
The identification requirement applies to bar and club businesses. Restoration companies with a bar area and few standing places are excluded. The identification requirement ensures that identity is verified by obliging bar and club operators to compare the entries with a reliable official ID (passport, identity card or driver's license) when maintaining the presence list.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: From July 6, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg is requiring all arriving passengers from listed 'risk areas' to register with the cantonal authorities within 2 days from the arrival in order to monitor the compliance with the federal quarantine requirements.
target_geog_level: One or more regional groupings

description: In accordance with federal guidelines, the Swiss canton of Glarus imposed contact tracing requirements upon establishments (and events) such as restaurants, clubs, and bars, effective from July 20. These rules apply if no social distancing (min. 1.5m distance or masks) can be maintained. Establishments must collect contact information from every single guest and verify their accuracy (by means such as ID checks or calls to provided phone numbers), as well as store them electronically, ordered by dates. Data must be provided to cantonal health authorities within 2 hours upon request, and a contact person must be available for this purpose daily between 8 AM and 8 PM. Violations on purpose are subject to fines up to 10,000 CHF (up to 5000 CHF for violations by negligence).
type_sub_cat: Who a person has come into contact with over time
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: Switzerland, Geneva--The Department of Security, Employment and Health (DSES), the Grand Conseil de la nuit and the company 2GIK Srl have announced the deployment of an app that "allows the cantonal doctor's service to obtain, in the event of a proven COVID-19 case, the list of people in contact with the patient, to warn them of possible contamination and to inform them of the measures to be taken." The app has been active since June 20 with certain venues, but following July 23 the app will be extended to all members of the Grand conseil de la nuit.

description: On 13th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel created 7 triage centers to sort suspect patients depending on the seriousness of their symptoms, and decide whether or not they should get tested. Based on several health checks conducted at the centers (fever checks, blood pressure, oxygen saturation tests...), patients are either sent to the hospital or back home. An 8th center managed by Mdecins du Monde has also been created to welcome undocumented immigrants and asylum seekers. A telephone line has been opened to book appointments at the centers. This policy overall aims at relieving the congestion in hospitals.
type_sub_cat: Temporary Medical Centers
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
In Switzerland, the state council of the canton Zurich decided that from the 1st of April on additional health workers have to be hired because the outbreak of COVID-19 shows that the cantonal medical service is only able to handle smaller, local exposures but it is not set up for large, nationwide events.
The detailed list is:

-	1.0 positions senior physician, (wage class 22) 
-	1.8 positions Research Associate, (wage class 20) 
-	0.5 positions as an assistant doctor, (wage class 19) 
-	1.0 position administrative secretary, (wage class 12) 

This is a total job increase of 4.3
type_sub_cat: Doctors
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: In Switzerland, the state council of the canton Zurich decided that the cantonal pharmacy of Zurich is authorized to perform the service contract with Post CH AG. This is based on the fact that the current measures are not suitable for the continuous operation with its expected handling volumes and frequencies of more than 100 orders per day. Therefore, to provide the needed supply to around 6000 health care institutions (hospitals, medical practices etc.) in the canton of Zurich with protective material it is necessary to find as fast as possible a new warehouse and delivery logistics with an external logistics service provider being constructed

description: In Switzerland, the state council of the canton Zurich decided that the cantonal pharmacy of Zurich is authorized to perform the service contract with Post CH AG. This is based on the fact that the current measures are not suitable for the continuous operation with its expected handling volumes and frequencies of more than 100 orders per day. Therefore, to provide the needed supply to around 6000 health care institutions (hospitals, medical practices etc.) in the canton of Zurich with protective material it is necessary to find as fast as possible a new warehouse and delivery logistics with an external logistics service provider being constructed
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: In Switzerland, in the canton Zurich the medical association organizes on behalf of the health department of the Canton of Zurich (AGZ) the medical emergency service. It operates to do so with its subsidiary AGZ Support AG through the canton and the municipalities financed triage centre, which can be reached 24/7 via the emergency number 0800 33 66 55 is. This triage centre comes to ensure orderly care and triage of patients in the event of a pandemic and plays an important role for the greatest possible relief of the emergency departments of hospitals because it is the first point of contact for the residents when symptoms of COVID-19 appear. The triage centre is located in Zurich Oerlikon. It is set up to deal with a high load of calls through 12 additional external employees that answer these calls in home office. To be prepared for the worst case scenario of a severely restricted accessibility of the triage centre for the employees or a larger amount of sick employees additional 25 home office jobs will be created.
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 27th, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health announced that with the help of Swisscoms analyses and visualisations, it is assessing whether the ban on gathering of more than five people in public ( by the Federal Council as of March 21st) is being respected. At no point location data from Swisscom are provided, merely analyses and visualisations. The data on which the analyses are based are anonymised and aggregated. It is not possible to make inferences about specific individuals. As soon as COVID-19 Ordinance 2 is abrogated, the Federal Office will not be provided with any further analyses.

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau decided at the 1st of April that from the 2nd of April on the hospitals are exempted from certain regulations within the scope of fulfilling the special regulation (SonderV 20-1).

To authorize the hospitals for treatment regardless of the hospital list  8 para. 3 of the ordinance on the hospital list about the barriers and the spectrum of the service orders placed on the hospital list is suspended
Irrespective of the performance mandate, hospitals are authorized to treat patients within their medical area of competence. 
Treatments that are performed outside an assigned performance mandate and within the medical competence area are to be billed based on the Aargau tariff specified by the Department of Health and Social Affairs (DGS) in a specific case. The approved Aargau tariff for early rehabilitation is to be applied for the convalescence departments to be created by rehabilitation clinics.
Based on Section 7 (4) of the hospital list, the Department of Health and Social Affairs can also issue hospitals that do not fulfill the requirements of Section 2 (2) of the hospital list as well as the procedure, the documents and the procedure in accordance with Section 35 hospital list. 

To authorize inpatient care facilities to create bed capacity  13 para. 1 letter b and para. 2 of the Nursing Ordinance (PflV) is suspended.
The  4 para. 2 letter b of the Care Act (PflG), the guideline value for the proof of need is suspended.
type_sub_cat: Hospitals
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On 13th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel created 7 triage centers to sort suspect patients depending on the seriousness of their symptoms, and decide whether or not they should get tested. Based on several health checks conducted at the centers (fever checks, blood pressure, oxygen saturation tests...), patients are either sent to the hospital or back home. An 8th center managed by Mdecins du Monde has also been created to welcome undocumented immigrants and asylum seekers. A telephone line has been opened to book appointments at the centers. This policy overall aims at relieving the congestion in hospitals. On 15th April 2020, the canton of Neuchtel reduced the number of triage centers from 8 to 5 in order to match the demand and the resources. UPDATE: The original policy featured 7 triage centers to sort Covid-19 suspect patients, but on 15th April 2020, they were reduced to 5 centers.
type_sub_cat: Temporary Medical Centers
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On April 16, the Swiss Canton Grisons announces to coordinate the organization of low-cost accommodation for workers from Italy with the affected communities in the regions of Bernina, Maloja and Engiadina Bassa / Val Mstair and sets up a hotline for cross-border commuters.

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau the Federal Department of Home Affairs decided that from the 16th of April on the daily flat rate in convalescence departments in the rehabilitation clinics for covid-19 is CHF 913.

The canton Aargau offers people with low income a premium reduction for their health insurance premiums
If their financial situation gets worse there will be the possibility for more than 6 months to get an extraordinary adjustment for their premium reduction. This would be the case if the income decreased by at least 20%. Also, the senior civil servant decided that the waiting period of 6 months for the premium reduction will be abrogated.

For all persons who are currently on the list of defaulting insured persons, the postponement of benefits will be suspended from now until the extraordinary situation has ended.

The use of the mobile PalliativeSidelx enables COVID-19 patients in retirement homes without specialization for extreme palliative situations to be accompanied, fearless and dignified in the familiar environment.
type_sub_cat: Health Insurance
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau gifted from the 24th to the 27th of April in total 280000 masks to around 19000 reopened businesses. Masks were handed out in the cities Baden, Frick, Klliken und Wohlen
The cantonal police of Aargau, the with the industrial and trade supervision of the office for economy and labor as well as the office for consumer protection started first checks of businesses. These checks showed that businesses own a safety concept and that they are ready to implement the guidelines by the federal office of public health.

If the controlling bodies find slight deficits they will take care of them on site. They inform and sensitize the employees and the business about the protective measures and guidelines.
type_sub_cat: Masks
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On 22nd March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel announced that the military would provide assistance in the 2 Neuchtel hospitals from 23rd March on by making 90 soldiers and 4 ventilators available to the canton. The soldiers will take charge of basic care to allow civil medical professionals to focus on more important treatments and Covid-19 cases. On 24th April 2020, the canton announced that the military would withdraw in the evening from the cantonal hospitals, now that the peak period of the epidemic was over. The canton specified that the soldiers could be called back within 24 hours and deployed within 72 hours if the situation worsened again. UPDATE: The original mobilization of the military in the Neuchtel hospitals had no end date, but on 24th April 2020, the canton announced that the army would withdraw from the hospitals in the evening of the same day.
type_sub_cat: Ventilators
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On 12th March 2020, the RHNe (hospital network) in the Swiss canton of Neuchtel decided to cancel all non-essential elective surgeries from 13th March 2020 on. The measure will be effective until further notice and during the whole peak period of the epidemic. The policy overall aims at making more resources available (hospital staff, hospital beds) to welcome Covid-19 patients. On 23rd April 2020, the RHNe announced that it would resume non-essential elective surgeries on 27th April 2020, thus ending the original policy. UPDATE: The original cancellation of non-essential elective surgeries didn't have an end date; but on 23rd April 2020, the RHNe (hospital network of Neuchtel) announced that it would resume elective surgeries on 27th April 2020.
type_sub_cat: Hospitals
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
From April 2 onwards, the Swiss federal costoms administration builds up so-called "Green Lanes" at some crossings of the Swiss border to optimize and speed up the import of important goods for the maintenance of the national economic supply as well as the enterance of priority professional groups, especially those working in the health sector. UPDATE: Since April 29, the following border crossings have "Green Lanes": 
Basel/Weil am Rhein-Autobahn; Rheinfelden-Autobahn; Basel/St. Louis-Autobahn; Kreuzlingen; Neuhausen am Rheinfall; Rafz / Solgen; Ramsen; Thayngen; Au; Schaanwald; St. Margrethen; Mendrisiotto SD Confine (Stabio)

description: On 17th March 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchtel sent 50 members of the civil protection to provide assistance in the cantonal EMS ("tablissements mdico-sociaux", also called "homes"; nursing homes). On 20th May 2020, the canton announced that the civil protection would progressively withdraw its members from the EMS from now on, and up until the month of June. NB: for the sake of the survey, we will consider 1st June 2020 as the end date for this policy (see the wording in the source), i.e. that the civil protection will have withdrawn the totality of its members by 1st June 2020. UPDATE: The original mobilization of the civil protection in the EMS didn't have an end date, but on 20th May 2020, the canton of Neuchtel announced that the civil protection would withdraw progressively from the EMS from now until the month of June (for the sake of the survey, we will consider that end date as 1st June 2020).
type_sub_cat: Other Heath Staff
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The Canton Schaffhausen in Switzerland opens on March 25, 2020 a center for medical testing of individuals with typical COVID-19 symptoms. This policy is implemented by the public health department of the Canton Schaffhausen. This Center is runned by Schaffhausen' physicians and is supported by the Swiss civil defence and volunteers from the health sector. The testing capacities and contact tracing capacities have been enlarged. UPDATE: The testing capacities and the capacities for contact tracing should be enlargened, the public health department of the canton Schaffhausen said on July 8th. Responsible for the enlargement of the testing capacities is the Task-Force called "Kantonale Abklrungszentrum (KAZ). The opening hours of KAZ have been extended. Furthermore general practitioners and pharmacies are allowed to test people with symptoms. Moreover measures are planned when there might occur a superspreader event.
type_sub_cat: Public Testing Facilities (e.g. drive-in testing for COVID-19)
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country
enforcer: Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The canton Schaffhausen announced the recall of contaminated face masks. The authorities said on July 10th 2020, that the face masks which were stocked in 2007 in case of a pandemic, are microbiologically contaminated. Citizens who have received those contaminated masks are going to be contacted by the "Kantonale Fhrungsorganisation (KFO). The old masks are going to be replaced with new ones.

target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: The canton Schaffhausen in Switzerland applies contact tracing again to contact person who are tested positive on Covid-19. This policy was announced on May 7th 2020 and starts the same day. Bars and clubs are obliged to check the persons contact details by checking their ID's. UPDATE: Clubs and bars in the canton schaffhausen are obligated to check the validity of persons contact details by checking their ID's. The reason is the increasing number of infections which are caused by bigger groups in bars and clubs.

description: The Canton Schaffhausen in Switzerland opens on March 25, 2020 a center for medical testing of individuals with typical COVID-19 symptoms. This policy is implemented by the public health department of the Canton Schaffhausen. This Center is runned by Schaffhausen' physicians and is supported by the Swiss civil defence and volunteers from the health sector. UPDATE: Due to the rising numbers of infections during the holidays, the local health department of the canton Schaffhausen implemented a new testing concept. The new test concept should shorten the time between testing and telling the result to the tested person. Furthermore the capacities for contact tracing had been extended. description:
On the 26th of August 2020, the Swiss Canton of Vaud announcedThe opening of a test center specially dedicated to children and accompanying adults will expand the testing offer in the canton. 

This pediatric reference center, managed by the CHUV, offers families 6 days a week easy access to the test as well as, depending on the situation, a family consultation.

This center is open to all children and their parents aged 0 to 18 for any COVID-19 issue.

description: The Canton Swiss of Vaud is preparing its system in order to be able to start vaccinating as soon as the first vaccines are delivered by the Confederation. Mobile teams will be operational from January 11th 2021. Vaccination centers will also be opened in the various regions of the canton. The aim of this strategy is to protect the vulnerable population first. Vaccination will not be compulsory.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
On January 25th, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Public Health informed on its webside about a new Coronavirus outbreak in Chine.
The National Reference Center for Emerging Viral Diseases (NAVI) in Geneva is able to detect the new coronavirus by laboratory diagnostics. Suspected cases would be clarified according to the existing guidelines for MERS and, if necessary, treated.
The Head of the Division of Infectious Diseases of the university hospital of Geneva told Swiss public television on January 24: that the test is very simple: a swab is taken from the back of the throat or from the nose with a cotton bud. It would be applied to people coming back from China who present cold-like symptoms that include coughing, fever, muscular pain and breathing difficulties.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On February 27, the Swiss Canton Ticino announces that starting the next day laboratory tests on possible infections are directly carried out in Ticino.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: The Canton Schaffhausen in Switzerland announced that it's hospital prepare a pre-triage to seperate persons with the Coronavirus from persons without the Virus. If the persons are tested positive they are put in Isolationfacilities inside the hospitals. The Canton Schaffhausen implemented this strategy due to the increasing number of positive tested persons in the Canton. This policy starts at March 9th 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On March 10th, the Jura canton in Switzerland announced the conditions for testing eligibility in the province. 

In order to be eligible for testing, one must display respiratory symptoms (cough) as well as a fever and at least one of the following three criteria: presenting severe symptoms requiring hospitalization, being a "vulnerable" population segment or being a healthcare professional working in a healthcare facility.

Individuals who present symptoms but are not vulnerable won't be tested for COVID-19.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
On March 10th, the Jura canton in Switzerland announced the conditions for testing eligibility in the province. 

In order to be eligible for testing, one must display respiratory symptoms (cough) as well as a fever and at least one of the following three criteria: presenting severe symptoms requiring hospitalization, being a "vulnerable" population segment or being a healthcare professional working in a healthcare facility.

Individuals who present symptoms but are not vulnerable won't be tested for COVID-19. UPDATE: On May 7th, the Jura canton in Switzerland announced the implementation of new federal rules for COVID-19 testing eligibility. Indeed, it is now recommended that anyone exhibiting COVID symptoms (loss of taste, loss of smell, fever, acute respiratory distress) gets tested.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: According to the announcement of March 12 and in accordance with the BAG recommendations, not all suspected COVID cases are being tested in the Canton of Zug. Tests are only necessary for people who show severe symptoms or have an increased risk of complications. In addition, tests will continue to be carried out on healthcare professionals and staff of nursing homes with mild respiratory diseases. Since March 9, the tests can be carried out in doctors' surgeries in the canton, although advance notification by telephone is mandatory. All other persons who experience symptoms of a possible respiratory disease (cough/respiratory complaints and fever) should stay at home for up to 24 hours after the symptoms have subsided and should only contact their family doctor by telephone or, if he or she cannot be reached, the emergency medical service if their state of health deteriorates.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On March 13, the Swiss Canton Grisons announces that the Federal Office of Public Health does no longer carry out comprehensive tests. Only people with symptoms from risk groups and patients with particularly severe symptoms are tested. This policy is announced together with the declaration of the "extraordinary status" in the Canton.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: The Canton Basel Landschaft (Switzerland) opens two test centers on March 18 where people over 16 years with symptoms can be tested.

description: The Canton Schaffhausen in Switzerland opens on March 25, 2020 a center for medical testing of individuals with typical COVID-19 symptoms. This policy is implemented by the public health department of the Canton Schaffhausen. This Center is runned by Schaffhausen' physicians and is supported by the Swiss civil defence and volunteers from the health sector.
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country
enforcer: Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On March 25th, the Canton of Lucerne, Switzerland opens a Drive-In-test center (canceled end of May).
 UPDATE: The 'drive-in' Covid-19 test facility that started testing on March 25th, has stopped operating by the end of May.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On March 27 the Government of Thurgau Canton has announced, that mobile Covid-19 are available for citizens. Patients who are suspected of having Covid-19 infection can be tested at home.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On April 2nd, the Canton of Bern, Switzerland opens a Drive-In-test center
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On April 2, the canton of Bern, Switzerland, opens a drive-through test center with online registration. Persons outside vulnerable groups are able to get tested, as well. Test capacity is increasing to 500 tests a day.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: Swiss canton Zurich recommends all hospitals to test arriving people for SARS-CoV-2, even if they do not show any symptoms on April 2.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: From April 14, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg published an online COVID-19 testing form to assess one's individual risk of having contracted the coronavirus for patients who do not have severe symptoms. The check then puts those individuals in contact with a testing centre, and gives further information on isolation and self-quarantine.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On April 16, swiss canton Zurich recommends that with immediate effect all care facilities and nursery homes should test their residents/employees for SARS-CoV-2, if there is one person tested positive: All people on the same ward should be tested.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On 27th April 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel decided to start testing every suspect patient presenting with Covid-19 symptoms. This testing policy will be implemented from 29th April 2020 on.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On April 30, the Swiss Canton Ticino launches a cantonal-wide serological test series with 1.500 people, which received an invitation letter. The data collected will allow to estimate the spread of the new Coronavirus in Ticino and to follow its evolution in the coming months, and will therefore be able to contribute to the development and implementation of targeted measures to prevent and control the epidemic in the medium term.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On May 7, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg published guidelines of a new testing strategy in order to be able to test more people. The strategy includes the online 'Coronacheck' test for people with mild symptoms as well as testing centres for people experiencing symptoms.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On May 7th, the Jura canton in Switzerland announced the implementation of new federal rules for COVID-19 testing eligibility. Indeed, it is now recommended that anyone exhibiting COVID symptoms (loss of taste, loss of smell, fever, acute respiratory distress) gets tested. Appointments can be booked via the hotline.
type_sub_cat: Other Health Testing
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On May 8th, the Canton government announced the relaxation of previous health policies such as restrictions on doctor's visits, nursing home visits and other related medical practices. However, in addition screening will heavily increase along with an informational campaign.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: In the swiss canton Valais all people with symptoms can and should be tested for the virus from May 14. Before this was valid only for severe cases or risk groups.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: Switzerland, Geneva: The Council of the State announced May 28, that tests prescribed by cantonal doctors as well as tests carried out by screening centers on low-symptom individuals will be reimbursed by the canton at 76 francs.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: The Canton of Zurich, Switzerland, launches a study on immunity to COVID-19 starting on June 8th, 2020. The commissioned research programm "Corona Immunitas" will start a series of three random tests during which around 3000 people in Zurich will be tested on antibodies against the coronavirus.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On April 2nd, the Canton of Bern, Switzerland opens a Drive-In-test center. On 23 June, the canton of Bern, Switzerland, announces that the Drive-In test centre will be closed on 26 June. UPDATE: Announced to close on 23 June
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: From 3 July on the Canton Zug expands the testing capacity. 1) At the Zug Cantonal Hospital, all persons can have a smear test performed in the "Walk-In" test center, without appointment. 2) In Hirslanden Andreas Clinic in Cham is a second test center. 3) As before, people with symptoms can also have themselves tested in a doctor's practice. However, advance notification by telephone is always necessary.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On July 6, the Swiss Canton Ticino publishes the first result of the serological test and announces to conduct further testing in August, November 2020 and May 2021. UPDATE: The serological test will be extended and conducted in August, November and May 2021 another time.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: Basel Landschaft (Switzerland) opens a new test center where people can be tested from 12 years age from August 1.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On October 30, 2020, the Swiss Canton of Lucerne opens another "Drive-In" test centre, which is open on weekdays between 1 pm and 7 pm. The "Drive-In" in Entlebuch is the third cantonal test centre.
type_sub_cat: Drive-in Testing Centers
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On December 4, 2020 the state goverment of Grisons, Switzerland announced that there will be mass testings in the regions Bernina, Engiadina Bassa/Val Mstair and Maloja from December 11 until December 13, 2020. The test will be voluntary and free for all citizens and tourists. Interested persons have to register.
type_sub_cat: Health testing of entire population under the government's jurisdiction
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On December 4, 2020 the state goverment of Grisons, Switzerland announced that there will be mass testings in the regions Bernina, Engiadina Bassa/Val Mstair and Maloja from December 11 until December 13, 2020. The test will be voluntary and free for all citizens and tourists. Interested persons have to register. UPDATE: Due to the high positive rate during the first mass testing, there were another mass testing/re-testing on December 17 and 18 in the region Bernina and the communities of Samedan and Samnaun
type_sub_cat: Health testing of entire population under the government's jurisdiction

description:
On February 24, the Swiss Canton Ticino reaffirms the federal list of recommendations of hygienic measures to prevent the spread of the Coronavirus:
-frequent hand washing
- limit touching one's face
- keep distance to sick people
- cough into tissues 
- wear masks only if one is sick
- stay at home in case of flue-symptoms
- avoid health facilities with influenza-like symptoms 
- not take antibiotics, if not prescribed 
- in case of doubt, one should not go to the hospital, but contact the family doctor or call the cantonal or federal hotline
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
link: Coronavirus, nessuna misura restrittiva in Ticino

description:
Switzerland, Geneva -- Preventive recommendations for general hygiene published on February 26, 2020. Recommendations include: 
- Wash your hands regularly with soap and water, or with a hydro-alcoholic solution.
- Cough and sneeze into a tissue. After use, throw the tissues in a trash can and wash your hands thoroughly with soap and water , or with a hydro-alcoholic solution .
- Cough and sneeze into the crook of the elbow in the absence of a tissue.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
In addition to federal regulations, as of March 3, 2020, the Swiss canton of Nidwalden imposed the following requirements on organizers of events with less than 200 participants:
A list of all participants and their contact information must be kept and submitted to the health authorities, sufficient facilities for hand washing must be provided, and an information sheet by the federal health authority must be publicly displayed during the event.
type_sub_cat: Other Areas Hygiene Measures Applied
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 11, the Swiss Canton Ticino introduces sanitary measures in prisons, i.e. social distancing, the provision of disinfectant and 15 cells are reserved for prisoners who would have to quarantine in case they had contact with an infected person.
type_sub_cat: Other Areas Hygiene Measures Applied
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On 12 March the Canton of Zug reminds of the BAG recommendation. In addition to regular hand washing, it is particularly important that sick people consistently stay at home. In addition, a distance of preferably two metres from other people should always be maintained if possible, for example when standing in line or in meetings.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On March 13, the Swiss Canton Grisons recommends that the population should strictly adhere to the rules of hygiene and social distancing in interpersonal relationships.
type_sub_cat: Other Areas Hygiene Measures Applied

description: On March 26, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health issued guidelines for burials of those who died on Covid 19.

description: On March 31, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg published guidelines with hygiene procedures to be followed in dealing with persons at the end of their lives, as well as in the case of death and burials. The guidelines outline hygiene measures to be taken to allow visits of the relatives of the affected person.

description: On July 1 the Government of Canton Thurgau has announced the recommendation to wear face masks, especially in situations when social distancing is impossible (in public transport)
type_sub_cat: Other Areas Hygiene Measures Applied
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: As the protection concepts of some industry associations are not entirely clear, the Canton of Zug, Switzerland, government council has therefore decreed that masks must be worn for all services involving physical contact or where the minimum distance cannot be maintained. This concerns, among others, hairdressing salons, tattoo studios, cosmetic studios or massage parlors. The obligation to wear masks applies to all those present, i.e. both customers and employees. Not covered by these rules are stores or restaurants, as there is no physical contact and the minimum distance can be maintained.
type_sub_cat: Hygiene measures for commercial areas
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: Basel-Landschaft (Switzerland) restricts public transportation to half of the usual passenger mass from March 16 until April 30.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On 17th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel restricted public transportation serviceq in order to limit movements within the canton, as part of the fight against Covid-19. The main public transportation company, TransN, will adopt its Saturday-schedule during the whole week , from this day on and until further notice.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: Swiss canton Zurich decided to reduce public transportation on March 18, the night bus will stop completely.

description: On March 21, the Swiss Canton Ticino requires the entire population to reduce travel to the minimum necessary as of March 22 until March 29. It is still allowed to go outside while respecting hygienic measures and social distancing.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On March 23, 2020 in Switzerland in Canton Ticino the Cantonal General Staff of Conduct (SMCC) in response to the measure that invites the population not to leave their home, requires everyone who is currently at a secondary house to report as soon as possible to the registry of the Municipality of reference. UPDATE: Originally the whole Ticino population was required not t travel, now the focus is on everybody who stays in a secondary home ( holiday home) with the obligation to report.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
On March 31, 2020 in Switzerland the Governments of Canton Ticino and Canton Grisons reaffirmed the call to second-home owners and tourists to limit their mobility to a minimum and, as far as possible, refrain from moving into their apartments, especially during Easter.
In order to convey this important message, a special leaflet has been created in Italian and German, shared with Ticino Turismo, which will be distributed by the police on the cantonal territory and outside the canton. UPDATE: Originally the Ticino population was asked to reduce travelling, then residents of a second home in Ticino were required to report, now a common urgend appeal of Canton Ticino and Canton Grisons is launched reiterating the invitation to tourists and owners of secondary homes to limit their movements and the occupation of holiday homes to a minimum, especially during the Easter period.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On April 3, the Swiss Canton Ticino, given the upcoming Easter holidays, issues the recommendation to guests outside the Canton to not stay or carry out any sporting activities in Ticino (in hotels, secondary homes, campsites, campers, caravans, etc.);
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
target_province: The recommendation to not come to Ticino is directed towards all other Swiss Cantons

description: On April 8th, 2020, the Swiss canton of Appenzell Innerrhoden has announced that routes and parking spaces close to the Alpstein (a hiking area) will be controlled and limited to prevent large gatherings of people.
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country

description: Swiss canton Zurich decided to reduce public transportation on March 18, the night bus will stop completely.This policy ends on May 11. UPDATE: This policy ends on May 11.

description: On 17th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel restricted public transportation serviceq in order to limit movements within the canton, as part of the fight against Covid-19. The main public transportation company, TransN, will adopt its Saturday-schedule during the whole week , from this day on and until further notice. On 27th April 2020, the Canton announced that public transportation (both regional and urban) would switch back to their normal schedule from 11th May 2020 on, thus ending the original policy. UPDATE: The original restriction of public transportation had no end date, but on 27th April 2020, Neuchtel announced that the main company, TransN, would switch back to its normal schedule from 11th May 2020 on, thus ending the original policy.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: ten streets in the city center will pass in the 20 km / h zone. The choice of a gentle mode for getting around avoids a transfer to the private car or an overload of public transport. These measures in favor of pedestrians will be effective from June 2 2020 to August 30 2020.

description: On 4th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel encouraged the EMS ("tablissement mdico-sociaux"; nursing homes) in the canton to ban, or at least limit visits to residents in order to protect them from coronavirus. It recommends as well that families of residents refrain from visiting their close ones in EMS if they have symptoms or come back from a high-risk region.

description: On 28 February, the cantonal management body decides that all cantonal employees should work from home if possible.

description:
On March 6, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Basel-City the Departement of Health has made recommendations for care homes on how to deal with visitors.
Residents of nursing homes cannot be expected not to receive a visit from their relatives and friends during the expected duration of the spread of the coronavirus. The health department therefore recommends that nursing homes limit visiting times and go through a well-developed health checklist with every visitor. If one question is answered with "yes", the person should be advised to postpone the visit.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On 6th March 2020, the hospital network (RHNe) of the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel decided to limit visits to patients to close family and partners only. Upon discussion with the doctors in charge, exceptions will be made for patients reaching the end of their life and for children in the pediatrics department.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: In the Swiss canton of Zurich, all prison visits, with the exception of pre-trial detention, are prohibited from March 10 until the end of June. Exceptions to this decision are visits by lawyers. Furthermore, inmates in closed custody who are entitled to vacation must postpone their furlough. In return, inmates were given more opportunities to make phone calls and even video calls to relatives. In addition, interrogations and court hearings are now partly conducted by video.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On 6th March 2020, the hospital network (RHNe) of the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel decided to limit visits to patients to close family and partners only. Upon discussion with the doctors in charge, exceptions will also be made for patients reaching the end of their life and for children in the pediatrics department. On 10th March 2020, the canton decided to ban all visits except in 3 cases: 1) for families of people reaching the end of their life 2) for parents of hospitalized children 3) for visits upon request from medical staff. UPDATE: The original compliance for this policy was mandatory with exceptions (for close family and partners, as well as for dying people and children), but the canton later reduced the exceptions to dying people, children and visits upon request by medical staff.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On March 11th, the Jura canton in Switzerland decided to forbid visits to elder people in nursing homes and similar facilities, starting March 12th.

Exceptions are allowed for specific circumstances (situations where the presence of a relative are needed). In these cases, individuals (maximum 3 per resident) would be allowed to visit their relative, given that they adhere by the health checks and measures implemented by the facility. Flexibility is advised for residents in more critical situations ("end of life situations").
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
On March 11th, the Jura canton in Switzerland decided to forbid visits to elder people in nursing homes and similar facilities, starting March 12th.

Exceptions are allowed for specific circumstances (situations where the presence of a relative are needed). In these cases, individuals (maximum 3 per resident) would be allowed to visit their relative, given that they adhere by the health checks and measures implemented by the facility. Flexibility is advised for residents in more critical situations ("end of life situations"). UPDATE: On April 8th, the Jura canton announced it would now forbid all visits to nursing homes, except in end of life situations.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On 13th of March 2020 the Uri special staff ("Sonderstab") decreed a visiting ban for the Kanton hospital, all nursing homes, all retirement homes, all homes for the handicapped until 30th of April. Exemptions can be made by the Kanton hospital for partners of parturients, parents, affiliated people of a dying person.

description: The canton Zurich (Switzerland) announces that all persons living in retirement homes must not visit relatives etc. from March 13. They may go outside by themselves, but in individual cases, the home management must decide how far and for how long.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
In Aargau, Switzerland all prison visits, including visits by lawyers, which must now be made by telephone, are prohibited from March 2020. The visiting ban will not be lifted until the end of May at the earliest. In-prison businesses are closed, recreational and educational activities were canceled.
Furthermore, occupancy is kept as low as possible in order to have sufficient capacity in the event of a crisis. Social distancing rules were implemented - particularly strictly for employees behind bars."
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On March 13, the Swiss Canton Grisons prohibits all visits to hospitals, retirement and nursing homes and other care institutions as of March 14 until at least April 30. The institution decides on exceptions (visits for patients in extraordinary situations: parents of children, partners of parturients and close relatives of dying people or patients in need of support). This decision is made in the context of the Cantonal declaration of an "extraordinary situation" (ausergewhnliche Lage)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: In the Swiss canton of St. Gallen, a ban on hospital visitation was implemented on March 14. Exceptions include parents of children in the hospital and partners of women giving birth.

description: Switzerland, March 14, 2020: The Federal Office of Health issues guidelines on visits to retirement and nursing homes.  Visits by family, friends and acquaintances should be prohibited as far as possible. If this cannot be implemented, the visitors must keep their distance from the residents and strictly adhere to the hygiene rules. Please also note the relevant cantonal guidelines.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In the middle of March, the canton of Bern, Switzerland, has placed a general lockdown on prisons. Prison staff have simplified operations to keep human resources in reserve in case of infection.The work of inmates has also been stopped or reduced to ensure safe distance can be kept. When possible prisoners are divided into individual cells.

Exceptions are possible, for example for expectant parents, parents of sick children in hospital care and for end of life situations.

description:
On March 16, 2020 at an extraordinary meeting the Swiss Federal Council took the decision to introduce more stringent measures to protect the public. It is calling on the elderly in particular to remain at home.  
Covid 19 Ordinance 2, Article 10b: " Principle 1 People at particular risk should stay at home and avoid crowds. 2 People over 65 years of age and people who have the following diseases in particular are deemed to be particularly at risk: high blood pressure, diabetes, cardiovascular diseases, chronic respiratory diseases, diseases and therapies, that weaken the immune system, cancer." (translated)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On 17th March 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchtel issued a directive through the cantonal doctor banning all services from external service-providers in EMS ("tablissements mdico-sociaux"; nursing homes). Only emergency treatments provided by physiotherapists, occupational therapists, chiropractors and osteopaths will be allowed.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On March 17th, 2020 the Government Council of Swiss Canton Uri announced  in accordance with the resolutions of the Federal Council (March 16) its support of the federal recommendation that
people who are particularly at risk should stay at home. People aged 65 and over and people who have the following diseases in particular are considered particularly at risk: high blood pressure, diabetes, cardiovascular diseases, chronic respiratory diseases, diseases and therapies that weaken the immune system and cancer.
On March 18 the cantonal executive staff ("kantonaler Fhrungsstab") specified that all eldery people with an age of 65 or above should stay at home and only go outside for urgent duties (as groceries...).
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On 4th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel encouraged the EMS ("tablissement mdico-sociaux"; nursing homes) in the canton to ban, or at least limit visits to residents in order to protect them from coronavirus. It recommends as well that families of residents refrain from visiting their close ones in EMS if they have symptoms or come back from a high-risk region. On 17th March 2020, the cantonal doctor issued a directive banning all visits in EMS, except in cases of emergency (to be assessed by the EMS supervisors). UPDATE: The original compliance for this policy was voluntary, but on 17th March 2020 the canton decided to make this measure mandatory (with exceptions).
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Switzerland, Geneva -- From March 18, all visits to all public and private medical establishments as well as to medico-social establishments (EMS) and establishments for disabled people are banned.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: Following a federal ordinance starting on the 18th of March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Vaud declared a lockdown policy regarding hospitals and nursing homes. Therefore, Visits in hospitals are in principle prohibited, unless the establishment submits a general concept to the Department of Health and Social Welfare. The policy is ending on the 1st of May 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description:
On March 19th, 2020 in Switzerland in Canton Uri  the cantonal executive staff ( "Kantonaler Fhrunsstab") ordered an exit restriction for people over 65 years of age as an immediate measure, starting the same day at 6 pm. Elder person are no longer allowed to leave their homes even to go shopping.
exepted are
walks of around two hours
going to the doctors office
attending a funeral in close family circle

description:
On March 17th, 2020 the Government Council of Swiss Canton Uri announced  in accordance with the resolutions of the Federal Council (March 16) its support of the federal recommendation that
people who are particularly at risk should stay at home. People aged 65 and over and people who have the following diseases in particular are considered particularly at risk: high blood pressure, diabetes, cardiovascular diseases, chronic respiratory diseases, diseases and therapies that weaken the immune system and cancer.
On March 18 the cantonal executive staff ("kantonaler Fhrungsstab") specified that all eldery people with an age of 65 or above should stay at home and only go outside for urgent duties (as groceries...). UPDATE: The original recommendation to stay at home for persons belonging to a risk group was open ended.Tthis policy ended March 21,2020 when a new stay at home order was issued for elderly , but not for persons belonging to a risk group because of a specific health condition.

description: The Swiss federal government advises people to stay at home, especially persons who are sick or over 65 years old. The people are advised to only go out if they have to go to work, buying groceries or have to help others. This affects the canton Glarus. This policy was announced on March 20, 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On April 28th, 2020 the Departement of Justice of Swiss Canton Basel City announced that since March 20, 2020, visits to cantonal prison facilities  have been prohibited as a result of the Covid 19 pandemic. Lawyers were not affected by this rule, they were still allowed to visit.This ban on visits will be lifted on May 9th. Suitable protective measures ensure that the hygiene and distance requirements are met to avoid infections.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On March 21, 2020 the Swiss Canton Ticino prohibited people aged over 65 or belonging to a vulnerable group from personally shopping groceries. They were invited to get help from relatives or to take advantage of the municipal services specially organized for home delivery. The Federal recommandation to stay at home for risk groups is emphazised.
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On March 19th, 2020 in Switzerland in Canton Uri the cantonal executive staff ( "Kantonaler Fhrunsstab") ordered an exit restriction for people over 65 years of age as an immediate measure, starting the same day at 6 pm. Elder person are no longer allowed to leave their homes, not even for shopping.
exepted are
walks of around two hours
going to the doctors office
attending a funeral in close family circle  
On March 21, 2020 the government council of Swiss canton Uri takes note of decision of the Federal Council ( Friday afternoon, March 20, 2020) to change the Covid-19 Ordinance again and finally regulate the use of public space.This reduces the cantons' leeway to a minimum. The measures ordered by the Federal Council on Friday therefore apply and the exit restriction for people over 65 years of age in Uri has been lifted.

description: Switzerland, March 14, 2020: The Federal Office of Health issues guidelines on visits to retirement and nursing homes.  Visits by family, friends and acquaintances should be prohibited as far as possible. If this cannot be implemented, the visitors must keep their distance from the residents and strictly adhere to the hygiene rules. Please also note the relevant cantonal guidelines. UPDATE: March 20, 2020: The Federal Government urgently asks retirement and nursing homes to ban visits. Except for relatives visiting a dying person. Explanation on Covid 19 ordinance 2, March 21: it is up to the cantons whether they want to regulate visiting times in old people's homes, or issue a ban on visits, as the COVID-19 Ordinance 2 does not contain any requirements in this regard.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On its press conference March 20, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council announced that it was not imposing a lockdown but appealing to the people's responsibility to adhere to the rules.
On March 22, the recommandations on the FOPHs webside "Protect yourself and others" were changed to
Stay at home from now on. Except in the following cases:
    You have to buy groceries
    You have to go to the doctors/to the pharmacy
    You have to help others
    You are unable to work from home and have to go to work
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

Exemptions can be made by the Kanton hospital for partners of parturients, parents, affiliated people of a dying person. Update: Update: The lockdown was prolonged until 31st of May.

Containments by sector or by floor of the institutions are now compulsory, with dedicated teams, while admitted residents are quarantined for 14 days, starting April 9.

description: On 4th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel encouraged the EMS ("tablissement mdico-sociaux"; nursing homes) in the canton to ban, or at least limit visits to residents in order to protect them from coronavirus. It recommends as well that families of residents refrain from visiting their close ones in EMS if they have symptoms or come back from a high-risk region. On 17th March 2020, the cantonal doctor issued a directive banning all visits in EMS, except in cases of emergency (to be assessed by the EMS supervisors). On 23rd April 2020, the cantonal doctor issued a directive reaffirming the ban on visits in EMS, but adding exceptions to this measure. Visits are only allowed in cases of emergency, especially when residents are reaching the end of their life, or when the visit happens in a specific visiting room validated by the cantonal public health office (SCSP).

description:
On March 16, 2020 at an extraordinary meeting the Swiss Federal Council took the decision to introduce more stringent measures to protect the public. It is calling on the elderly in particular to remain at home.  
Covid 19 Ordinance 2, Article 10b: " Principle 1 People at particular risk should stay at home and avoid crowds. 2 People over 65 years of age and people who have the following diseases in particular are deemed to be particularly at risk: high blood pressure, diabetes, cardiovascular diseases, chronic respiratory diseases, diseases and therapies, that weaken the immune system, cancer." (translated)	
 UPDATE: On April 16, 2020 change of ordinance (valid April 27): "People who are particularly at risk should stay at home and avoid crowds. If they leave the house, they take special precautions in order to be able to adhere to the recommendations of the FOPH regarding hygiene and social distance" (translated)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In the middle of March, the canton of Bern, Switzerland, has placed a general lockdown on prisons. Prison staff have simplified operations to keep human resources in reserve in case of infection.The work of inmates has also been stopped or reduced to ensure safe distance can be kept. When possible prisoners are divided into individual cells. On 30 April, the lockdown of prisons is eased. UPDATE: Lockdown of prisons eased, visitors allowed once again under certain restrictions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
On its FAQ sheet form April 29 th, 2020 the Swiss FOPHs answer to the question if the main message "stay at home" would still apply after the first easing of the measures on April 27th was: With every stage at which the Federal Council relaxes the measures, more people will leave their living areas again - but in stages.   On April 30th, the recommandations on the FOPHs webside "Protect yourself and others" were changed from "Stay at home from now on" to "Continue to work from home if possible"						
						
						
 UPDATE: On  April 30 the recommandations of the FOPH were changed to " continue to work from home if possible" instead of "stay at home".
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On May 8, 2020 the health departement of Swiss Canton Basel City has now issued instructions on how to regulate visits to nursing homes, in view of the general easing of the recommendations by the federal government. Visits primarily depend on whether a nursing home is affected by Covid 19 cases or not. The directive is also based on the principle of proportionality. Every care home has to set up a visit concept which ensures social distancing and hygiene rules, provision of masks or plexi glass, announcement of visitors and contact details of visitors.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: "On March 6, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Basel-City the Departement of Health has  recommends that nursing homes limit visiting times and go through a well-developed health checklist with every visitor. This policy was enden May 8. UPDATE: The recommendation for nursing homes to limit visitors and check the health of visitors ended May 8, when a new directive was issued urging nursing homes to set up a visitors concept.

description: From May 9, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg eased the lockdown restrictions imposed upon care homes in the canton, allowing relatives of resident to visit again. Visits will only be allowed to residents without confirmed COVID-19 infection and without suspicion of having contracted the virus. In addition care homes will need to have a safety plan complying with health restrictions to limit infections, including clear restrictions on registration, reception, hours and duration of visits, allowed set of individuals for visits, follow up, and hygiene measures.

description:
On March 16, 2020 in Switzerland, the canton Aargau decided to ban visits to hospitals and care homes.
Exemptions for end of life situations.
 UPDATE: On May 8, 2020 the Departement of Health and Social Affairs of Swiss Canton Aargau announced that starting May 11 the visiting ban to hospitals and care homes will be replaced by a controlled right to visit provided that adequate protective measures are taken. The institution management determines the exact framework conditions in the form of a visit concept. The hygiene and protective measures must be strictly observed. The responsibility lies with the institution management.

description: Switzerland, March 14, 2020: The Federal Office of Health issues guidelines on visits to retirement and nursing homes.  Visits by family, friends and acquaintances should be prohibited as far as possible. If this cannot be implemented, the visitors must keep their distance from the residents and strictly adhere to the hygiene rules. Please also note the relevant cantonal guidelines. UPDATE: May 11, 2020, the FOPH : It is important that visits in and outside the institutions should in principle be possible. Visits to particularly endangered residents should be very carefully planned by taking precautions (e.g. asking visitors after COVID- 19 symptoms, transparent barriers, limitation of the number of visitors and the time), so that the distance and hygiene rules are strictly adhered to.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On March 15, 2020 in Switzerland the government council of Canton Basel - Landschaft decided that visits to hospitals, nursing homes and similar institutions that care for persons from risk groups are prohibited. Exceptions (e.g. visits for patients in extraordinary situations: Parents of children, partners of women giving birth and close relatives of dying people or patients in need of support) are decided by the institution.
This is initially set to last at least till April 30. UPDATE: As of May 11, 2020 relatives will be allowed to visit residents of Basel-Landschaft retirement centers and nursing homes again. The government council has confirmed the relaxation of the visiting ban with its decision of May 5.
Clear rules apply to the visits, which must be followed by all:
    Relatives register for the visit
    Compliance with hygiene and protection measures
    Meeting in specially equipped visiting rooms or visiting boxes
    maximum of 5 persons (incl. resident)
    Registration of visitors
    strict separation of the flow of persons
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On 6th March 2020, the hospital network (RHNe) of the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel decided to limit visits to patients to close family and partners only. Upon discussion with the doctors in charge, exceptions will be made for patients reaching the end of their life and for children in the pediatrics department. On 10th March 2020, the canton decided to ban all visits except in 3 cases: 1) for families of people reaching the end of their life 2) for parents of hospitalized children 3) for visits upon request from medical staff. On 14th May 2020, the RHNe added an exception to the list of allowed visits: in the maternity ward, partners / husbands can now accompany their spouses during prenatal examinations and they can now visit their spouses (and the baby) after they have given birth. UPDATE: The original ban on visits in the Neuchtel hospital network (RHNe) was mandatory with only 3 exceptions (family of dying people, parents of hospitalized children and visits upon request from medical staff). But on 14th May 2020, the RHNe relaxed the compliance of this policy by adding an exception to the list of allowed visits: in the maternity ward, partners / husbands can now accompany their spouses during prenatal examinations and they can now visit their spouses (and the baby) after they have given birth.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
