Exceptions to this policy are: 1) patients coming for an appointment in the oncology, obstetrics and neurology departments 2) patients who have to be accompanied for health reasons 3) if the medical team determines that visits for a patient are necessary.

description:
On 4th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel encouraged the EMS ("tablissement mdico-sociaux"; nursing homes) in the canton to ban, or at least limit visits to residents in order to protect them from coronavirus. It recommends as well that families of residents refrain from visiting their close ones in EMS if they have symptoms or come back from a high-risk region. On 17th March 2020, the cantonal doctor issued a directive banning all visits in EMS, except in cases of emergency (to be assessed by the EMS supervisors). On 23rd April 2020, the cantonal doctor issued a directive reaffirming the ban on visits in EMS, but adding exceptions to this measure. Visits are only allowed in cases of emergency, especially when residents are reaching the end of their life, or when the visit happens in a specific visiting room validated by the cantonal public health office (SCSP). On 20th May 2020, the canton formally announced that visits in EMS would resume shortly (on 25th May 2020), thus ending the original policy.

NB: the date of the 25th May was announced earlier - on 8th May 2020 -, but the definitive measures were only confirmed on 20th May 2020. UPDATE: The original ban on visits didn't have an end date, but on 20th May 2020 the canton of Neuchtel announced that visits would be allowed again from 25th May 2020 on, thus ending the original policy.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
On 17th March 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchtel issued a directive through the cantonal doctor banning all services from external service-providers in EMS ("tablissements mdico-sociaux"; nursing homes). Only emergency treatments provided by physiotherapists, occupational therapists, chiropractors and osteopaths will be allowed. On 20th May 2020, the canton announced that non-urgent services (hairdresser, podiatrist, chaplaincy, etc...) could be provided again to residents of EMS from 25th May 2020 on, thus ending the original policy.

NB: the date of the 25th May was announced earlier - on 8th May 2020 -, but the definitive measures were only confirmed on 20th May 2020. UPDATE: The original ban on services from external service-providers in EMS had no end date, but on 20th May 2020, the Canton of Neuchtel announced that these services could be provided again to residents from 25th May 2020 on, thus ending the original policy.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
On 28th of May the Kanton special staff ("Sonderstab") ended the general lockdown of hospitals, elderly homes and homes for the handicappped. But only homes and institutions which require the following conditions are now allowed to reopen:
-they must have a safety concept
-no people who had contact to COVID-19 infected people are allowed in
-only patients who are able to abeit to hygiene and social distancing laws are allowed to leave the instituin or home alone.
If those conditions are not met they are not allowed to reopen. If neccessary, the managements of homes and institutions are allowed to close down again.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On 13th of March 2020 the Uri special staff ("Sonderstab") decreed a visiting ban for the Kanton hospital, all nursing homes, all retirement homes, all homes for the handicapped until 30th of April. Exemptions can be made by the Kanton hospital for partners of parturients, parents, affiliated people of a dying person. The policy was prolonged to 31st of May but ended earlier on 28th of May. UPDATE: The first update of the policy was supposed to last until 31st of May but the policy was already ended on 28th of May.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: From May 1, 2020 onwards, the Department of Finance and Social Services allows visits in nursing homes again under strong regulations. The visit must be registered in advance, the visit must take place in designated visiting zones of the nursing home and the distancing measures must be guaranteed. UPDATE: The original strong restrictions on visits in nursing homes were further relaxed and visits are generally allowed again from May 30, 2020 onwards.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On June 5th, the government of the Swiss Canton of Solothurn announced that hospitals would have to develop a hygiene concept to allow visitors. Minimum requirements include visitor identification and recording, not more than two visitors at shared rooms at a time and visitors following the same hygienic measures as healthcare staff (e.g. wearing masks). The policy was scheduled to start on June 6th.

description:
On March 15, 2020 in Switzerland the government council of Canton Basel - Landschaft decided that visits to hospitals, nursing homes and similar institutions that care for persons from risk groups are prohibited. Exceptions (e.g. visits for patients in extraordinary situations: Parents of children, partners of women giving birth and close relatives of dying people or patients in need of support) are decided by the institution.
This is initially set to last at least till April 30. UPDATE: announced June 2: the government council has lifted the restriction on visits to hospitals, old people's and nursing homes, and homes for the disabled and young people as of June 6, 2020. The institutions are required to develop and implement a specific protection concept that meets the requirements of federal law. A protection concept "opening strategy" for nursing homes was developed by the association CURAVIVA Baselland in close cooperation with the cantonal Office of Health.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On 8th June 2020, the RHNe announced visits could resume under conditions in its centers of Pourtals and la Chaux-de-Fonds (more generally in all of its centers - see records 2360005 and 8718977 for the other centers)  from 9th June 2020 on. According to the new visiting regime, visits are limited to one visitor per day per patient, for one hour between 3pm and 5pm. The RHNe also added exceptions to this new visiting system: 1) the two parents can visit their children in the pediatrics department 2) the father and the siblings of a newborn can visit the mother and the baby at the maternity ward 3) more visits can be allowed for dying people or patients in intensive care.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On 20th May 2020, the RHNe (hospital network) of the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel announced that on their center of la Chrysalide, visits will only be allowed upon decision from the medical team. This decision will be made on a case-by-case basis, depending on the patient's medical state. The medical team will also decide under which conditions visits are allowed for a patient. Only first-degree relatives will be allowed to visit patients. On 8th June 2020, the RHNe announced a new visiting regime for all of their centers (including la Chrysalide) from 9th June 2020 on: visits are limited to one visitor per day per patient, for one hour between 3pm and 5pm. It also added exceptions to this new visiting system: 1) the two parents can visit their children in the pediatrics department 2) the father and the siblings of a newborn can visit the mother and the baby at the maternity ward 3) more visits can be allowed for dying people or patients in intensive care. UPDATE: The original compliance of this policy was mandatory with exceptions (visits allowed by the medical team). On 8th June 2020, these exceptions were modified and expanded (time and number of visitors restrictions + exceptions for pediatrics department and maternity ward as well as for dying people).
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On 20th May 2020, the RHNe (hospital network) of the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel announced that visits could resume under conditions in the rehabilitation centers of Locle and Val-de-Ruz. Conditions are the following: patients are only allowed to receive one visitor per day for one hour between 4pm and 6pm. Each visitor will have to wear a mask and to disinfect his/her hands. Only first-degree relatives will be allowed to visit patients. On 8th June 2020, the RHNe announced a new visiting regime for all of their centers (including Locle and Val-de-Ruz) from 9th June 2020 on. In the case of Locle and Val-de-Ruz, visits are still limited to one visitor per day per patient, still for one hour but now between 3pm and 5pm. The RHNe also added exceptions to this new visiting system: 1) the two parents can visit their children in the pediatrics department 2) the father and the siblings of a newborn can visit the mother and the baby at the maternity ward 3) more visits can be allowed for dying people or patients in intensive care.

description: On 20th May 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel confirmed that visits in the RHNe (Neuchtel hospital network) were still banned in their centers of la Chaux-de-Fonds and Pourtals (i.e. their classic, intensive-care centers) up until at least 8th June 2020. Exceptions to this policy are: 1) patients coming for an appointment in the oncology, obstetrics and neurology departments 2) patients who have to be accompanied for health reasons 3) if the medical team determines that visits for a patient are necessary. On 8th June 2020, the RHNe announced that from 9th June 2020 on, visits could resume under conditions in the centers of la Chaux-de-Fonds and Pourtals, thus ending the original policy. UPDATE: The original ban on visits in the RHNe centers of la Chaux-de-Fonds and Pourtals was set to last until 8th June 2020 at least. On 8th June 2020, the RHNe announced that visits could resume under conditions in these two centers, thus ending the original policy.

description: From June 29, the health task force of the Swiss Canton of Fribourg requires all care institutions to maintain hygiene and distancing measures, while the systematic control of all entries into the institutions is not required anymore. However, a physical barrier needs to be maintained at the entry and visitors will be traced. Residents are allowed to leave the facilities again as long as they or their relatives are able to abide by the hygiene and behavioural measures, and to identify contacts. Exceptional situations, such as the end of life, immune weakness, minors, etc., will be decided upon individually. The implementation of these measures will be supported by a mobile COVID-Team of care workers, representatives of the care institutions, of the municipalities, and of a doctor who will be in charge.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: From May 9, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg eased the lockdown restrictions imposed upon care homes in the canton, allowing relatives of resident to visit again. Visits will only be allowed to residents without confirmed COVID-19 infection and without suspicion of having contracted the virus. In addition care homes will need to have a safety plan complying with health restrictions to limit infections, including clear restrictions on registration, reception, hours and duration of visits, allowed set of individuals for visits, follow up, and hygiene measures. The measures were further eased from June 29. UPDATE: From June 29, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg further eased the lockdown restrictions imposed upon care institutions.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: From July 1, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg announced eased lockdown restrictions for its hospitals, clinics, and birth centres. Under the new restrictions, the number of visitors is limited to 1 per day, visitors will need to be free of symptoms, they need to abide by the federal hygiene and distancing measures, they need to abide by the specific guidelines of the responsible institution/department, and visitors need to register while institutions need to keep a visitor list in order to allow tracing in the case of an infection.

description:
September 3rd 2020, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg has announced that the Siviriez EMS( nursing home) has a significant number of people positive for COVID-19.

Various measures have been taken by the DSAS
> Temporary stop of visits (except in special situations, such as end of life)
> Collective quarantine of residents and staff. They can however continue to work within the structure.
> Advice via the mobile nurse team and on-site visit
> Authorization to hire additional staff and support the search for staff for the EMS since this search is difficult
> Collaboration with the HFR regarding hospitalizations (reminder: hospitalizations for medical necessity, with the person's consent or advance directives)
> Establishment of psychological support for employees via EMUPS
> Possibility of support for the doctor responsible for the EMS
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
On March 16, the cantonal government of Obwalden announced the creation of a 'Cantonal Leadership Task Force' (Kantonaler Fhrungsstab, KFS) to support the relevant authorities.

Its tasks consist of coordinating measures, allocate contracts and orders, internal and external information, as well as serving as a point of contact for municipalities. In addition, it may be tasked with requesting assistance from civil protection or the military.

In consultation with the federal authorities, the three governments have agreed that ICU patients from France can be transferred to the cantonal hospitals. Further Swiss cantons ( Aargau, Bern, Fribourg, Geneva, Lucerne, Neuchtel, Saint Gallen, Schaffhausen, Thurgau, Vaud, Valais, Zurich ) offered help and took ICU patients from French regions Grand-Est and Franche-Comt.

description: From October 1, 2020, events with more than 1000 participants can take place again, if the canton approves them. This was decided by the Federal Council. The Zug police is already responsible for events with event risks and therefore has experience with the corresponding permits. For this reason, the Government Council also uses them as a licensing authority for major events in the sense of the Covid 19 ordinance, but the Government Council remains responsible for revoking them. Depending on the situation, the Zug police may impose conditions additional to the hygiene protection concept submitted by the organizers.

description: The local authorities of the Canton Schaffhausen plan a package of measures to support the local economy, the local authorities announced on the 14th of March 2020. The support plan includes a New Task Force which consists experts of the Department of Commerce  and the cantonal department of economical support. The policy should have ended on April 19, 2020 but it has been extended without an end date. UPDATE: The original policy to support the local economy with a package of measures, which was introduced by the government of the Kanton Schaffhausen has been extended. The original policy was introduced on March 24, 2020 and should have ended on April 19, but it was extended. A local council still can make financial decision to support the local economy and to fight the Corona Pandemic, without consulting the local council meeting.

description: The Swiss Canton Ticino makes use of the exceptional extension of restriction under certain conditions, allowed by a federal law that will come into force retroactively on March 21, when Ticino introduced the closure regime, this means that Ticino will no longer be illegally implementing restrictions not allowed under federal laws.
type_text: The federal law of March 13 announced that construction sites and business remain open with security measures. However, due to the worsening situation in the Canton Swiss, the Cantonal government decided to not follow and closed all construction sites and businesses. On March 27, the Federal Government then decided that Cantons, under certain circumstances, could go further and take stricter restrictive measures if they applied for it. Ticino implemented the exception clause immediately.

description: On 24th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel announced that its Department of consumption and veterinarian affairs could now take care of pets whose owners either had to go to the hospital due to Covid-19, or were sick and alone at home. Upon request by phone or email, the department will come and pick up the pet, and will charge the owner accordingly.
type_text: The Neuchtel Department of consumption and veterinarian affairs can take care of pets whose owners either have to go to the hospital due to Covid-19, or are sick and alone at home. description: On March 27, the Swiss Federal Government allowed Cantons under certain circumstances (insufficient capacities, elevated number of cross-border commuters) to temporarily restrict or stop the activity of entire economic sectors as opposed to the federal law. This policy was politicised as "Lex Ticino" as it was tailormade for its case.
type_text: The Swiss Federal Government issued a regulation which allowed Cantons that were especially affected by the pandemic and did not have sufficient resources to close or restrict further certain economic activities, even though the federal law was not restricting them. This policy was mainly targeted at the Swiss Canton Ticino, which decided to keep construction sites closed even though the Federal Government announced to keep them open. The policy thus allows Ticino to go implement stricter measures than the Federal Government.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On 2nd April 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchtel decided to temporarily reopen the welcome center for asylum seekers in Couvet (in addition to the permanent center in Tte-de-Ran). This policy aims at better complying with the Covid-related health recommendations (social distancing, quarantine if a resident is sick and has to isolate...). Several asylum seekers currently in the permanent center are to be transferred to Couvet in order to make the most of the available space of both centers.

description:
On 15th April 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel created a new organizational system for doctors' offices in order to separate Covid-19 suspect patients from other patients in need of regular medical monitoring. From 20th April 2020 on, 3 networks of doctors' offices are to be distinguished:

1) NETWORK A: only patients without Covid-19 who suffer from a chronic illness or another serious health problem requiring regular medical monitoring

2) NETWORK B (separated in 2 distinct channels): 
a. in the first channel, patients without Covid-19 who suffer from a chronic illness or another serious health problem requiring regular medical monitoring
b. in the second channel, patients suspect or diagnosed with Covid-19

3) NETWORK C: only patients suspect or diagnosed with Covid-19 who are presenting with aggravated symptoms

Patients are to be directed in one or the other network depending on their needs (treatment for chronic illness or Covid-19).
type_text: On 15th April 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel created a new organizational system for doctors' offices in order to separate Covid-19 suspect patients from other patients in need of regular medical monitoring. From 20th April 2020 on, 3 networks of doctors' offices are to be distinguished and patients are to be directed in one or the other network depending on their needs (treatment for chronic illness or Covid-19).
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On 25th May 2020, in light of the postponement of the municipal election (see record 2304992), the Swiss canton of Neuchtel decided to extend to the end of 2020 the term of office served by the municipal authorities elected in 2016. However, the canton ruled that the municipal authorities elected in 2016 could decide to end the 2016-2020 administrative period between the election of the new municipal authorities on 25th October 2020 and the end of 2020.

description:
The Canton Schaffhausen introduced a mandatory mask wearing for secondary schools (Kantonsschule, Berufsfachschulen, HKV). From August 10 onwards, students, teachers and other personnel have to wear masks inside schools. Exceptions are:
- when there is a minimum distance between people, 
- when there are seperating walls between people,
- teachers don't have to wear masks in frontal teaching classes,
- no mask wearing in sports classes,
- people don't have to wear masks when they are eating in the cantines,
- when people have a medical issue which allows them not to wear masks.

Students, teachers and other personnel have to bring their own masks, but in case the schools have to provide free masks for everyone. 
Furthermore when someone is coming back from a Covid-19 country of risk, this person is obliged to go into quarantine. 
Finally teachers, students and other school personnel have to self-declare that they are informed about the quarantine and mask rules in schools.
type_text: The obligation to wear masks in secondary schools
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Switzerland, February 27th, The Canton Ticino set up a special hotline for general and sanitary information, as well as for psychological in the context of Covid-19. description:

Therefore an information campaign for travelers and commuters at the borders and airports was started. A second information campaign on personal protection measures "So schtzen wir uns" (Protect yourself and others) is aimed at the general public. In a first step, the FOPH would like to make three important hygiene and behavior rules known: Wash your hands thoroughly, cough and sneeze into a tissue or the crook of your arm, stay at home if you have fever or a cough.

description:
On April 2, 2020 in Switzerland the government of Canton Jura informed the population on the importance of the protective measures against COVID 19, stay at home whenever possible, keep distance and avoid gathering.The cantonal police implements means to ensure compliance in all places, in particular by an equestrian brigade to easily access tourist sites where a high concentration of people can be expected. 
In addition, the Jura cantonal police ask bikers not to take the road during this extraordinary period. A simple fall could lead to the occupation of a hospital bed for several days and overload the health network.

description:
On April 2, 2020 in Switzerland the State Council of Canton Valais appeals to the population in view of Easter to adhere to the rules of the federal government:
Stay at home except to work, shop, visit a doctor, or help others
Don' t travel
Persons at risk are strongly advised to stay at home without exception unless they need to see a doctor
The State Council also recalls that assemblies are prohibited and that a social distance of two meters must be maintained.
The cantonal police ensures the strict application of these rules.

description: On May 11, the Swiss Canton Ticino issues recommendations on the use of masks. description: September 16th 2020, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg released a public awareness message stating that "You should never throw away your used mask on the street or in nature. After use, it should be disposed in a trash can. You may be fined for non-compliance with this instruction".
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On September 18th, Canton Vaud released several statements detailing the necessary adoption of ad hoc plans and containment measures. Despite this, the Canton insists it is within researched parameters and is seemingly improving the situation.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On October 1st, the Swiss Canton of Vaud announced that it would disseminate graphic posters about COVID as a public safety measure.
type_sub_cat: Both Disseminating and Gathering information related to COVID-19
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: 9th October 2020,  the Swiss Canton of Fribourg shared a public awareness message regarding the Christmas holidays. "In order to be able to celebrate the end of the year holidays in a serene atmosphere, the COVID-19 Coordination Unit looked into the issue and, after consultation with the cantonal doctor, recalls the importance of the health rules in force, in in particular strict respect for distances and barrier gestures. This generally means avoiding contact, providing sufficient space and promoting the organization of events outside ".
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: Nationwide Committee of Tajikistans Health Care and Social Protection Workers Union in cooperation with the ILO Bureau for Workers Activities (ACTRAV) in Dushanbe organised a conference Effects of COVID-19 on Tajikistans Health Care and Health Workers. Pandemic Response, Social Dialogue and Policies to Promote Occupational Safety and Health of Tajikistans Health Workers at Work.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the 11th of November 2020, the Swiss Federal Office of Public Health made available in most of the migration languages, the main poster of the public awareness campaign "Protect yourself and others". The goal is to share the basics Covid-19 tips to everybody.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the 12th of November 2020, The Swiss Federal Office of Public Health released a statement emphasizing on the importance of visiting the "Isolation and Quarantine" website if tested positive or in contact with a person infected by the Corona virus.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the 19th of November 2020, the Swiss Federal Office of Health released a video of public awareness about the importance of ventilation. Schoolrooms have to be aired out regularly to reduce the risk of infection, especially now during the coronavirus epidemic. The new video shows schoolchildren how to air out properly.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On the 1st of December 2020, the Swiss FOPH released as part of the  public awareness campaign "Protect yourself and others " new printed material. The goal of this action was to state the importance of being tested for Covid-19 if any symptom occurs. The poster also focuses on the fact that tests are free of charge.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: As part of the  public awareness campaign "Protect yourself and others" the Swiss Federal Office of public health released  on the 9th of December 2020 a new poster showing tips on how to restrain contacts before the Christmas Holidays.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On December 3rd 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Public Health announced that on Thursday December 10, a nationwide day (Talk about it, find help) will draw attention to the consequences of the Covid-19 crisis on mental health.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description:
On the 11th of December 2020, the Swiss Federal Council 
made available a poster summarizing the new dispositions regarding the Coronavirus during the holidays in effort the bring awareness to the situation and spread the rules around the country. Those dispositions are in place until the 22nd of January 2021.

description: Following the new dispositions adopted by the Swiss Council of the State of Fribourg, a new hotline has been set up to answer all questions from the population relating to daily life during the Covid-19 pandemic. This hotline is available from the 24th of October 2020.
type_sub_cat: Both Disseminating and Gathering information related to COVID-19
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On February 4, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health recommended on its webside to all persons having returned from China within the last 14 days: If you develop symptoms of a respiratory tract infection (fever, cough, shortness of breath)  stay at home, do not go out in public and contact a doctor immediately, by telephone first.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
The Swiss Federal Office of Public Health informed on its webside for health professionals ( February 17, 2020) that suspected cases (meeting the test criteria) and persons who tested positive for the coronavirus have to be isolated. The cantonal departements of health decide if the person is to be isolated at home or its hotelroom or is transferred to a hospital isolation ward. 
According to some newspapers and cantonal websides the people who tested positive had to be isolated in isolation wards of hospitals.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On its press conference on February 25, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health informed about the first person in Switzerland confirmed as being infected with the new coronavirus 2019-nCoV. People in close contact with the individual are being notified and placed in quarantine and their condition will be monitored over the next 14 days. On its webside ( February 16) the FOPH informed:" Should there be cases, the sick people would be isolated. Close Contact persons would have to be in quarantine for two weeks."  On the webside for health professionals ( Feb 17) the term close contact is specified:
Contact from less than 2 meters and for more than 15 minutes. People who live in the same household. Care or medical examination without protective gear. Direct contact with body fluids.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On 26 February, the Canton of Bern, Switzerland, announces that persons without symptoms may be allowed to partake in a 14-day quarantine at home.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
On February 26, 2020 the Swiss Federal Offiec of Public Health informed on its website: "If you have recently spent time in an area affected by the coronavirus. For 14 days after your departure:    If you have difficulties breathing, a cough or fever, stay at home or in your hotel. Do not go out in public. Immediately contact  first by phone  a doctor or health centre. Mention that you have recently been in an area affected by the coronavirus and have symptoms." Travelers and commuters from Italy are informed at the borders what to do if they have symptoms (difficulty breathing, cough or fever).People arriving at the airports are also informed.
affected areas are currently: China, Iran, Southkorea, Singapore, and in Italy the provinces Lombardy, Piemont and Venetia.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs

description: Feb 27,2020 Swiss Canton Basel City is closing one children day-care facility and sending 75 families in a 14 day- quarantine
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country

description:
On 1 March, the Canton of Bern, Switzerland, announced that children should not attend school if:
- they have visited an area hit by Corona and were in close contact with someone who has Corona,
- if they have returned from an area hit by Corona in the last 14 days and have symptoms of coughing, breathing problems, and fever,
- if they have a fever.
type_sub_cat: Other Quarantine
type_text: Children are not to attend school under certain conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On February 28, the Swiss Canton Ticino advises all parents to keep children with flu symptoms (fever, cough, cold) at home with the reopening of schools as of March 2.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
The Swiss Federal Office of Public Health informed on its webside for health professionals ( February 17, 2020) that suspected cases (meeting the test criteria) and persons who tested positive for the coronavirus have to be isolated. The cantonal departements of health decide if the person is to be isolated at home or its hotelroom or is transferred to a hospital isolation ward. 
According to some newspapers and cantonal websides the people who tested positive had to be isolated in isolation wards of hospitals. UPDATE: On March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases new guidelines for dealing with symptomatic persons and their contacts from March 9, 2020 .
At its press conference (March 6), the federal government admitted that it was no longer possible to isolate all positively tested people in hospitals.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases guidelines for dealing with confirmed cases from March 9, 2020 and an information sheet (March 7): What to do if you are infected with the new Coronavirus.
confirmed cases are isolated:
  At home, if the general condition permits (self-isolation)
Removal of isolation: 48 hours after the symptoms have subsided, provided that at least 10 days have passed since the onset of symptoms
  In severe cases in the hospital:
 Return home as soon as the clinical condition permits, or removal of isolation in the hospital in accordance with the criteria listed above.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description:
On March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases guidelines ( valid from March 9th) for persons who had close contact with someone who tested positive for the coronavirus.
Hospital doctors and doctors in private practice instruct the close contact persons (people living in the same household, intimate contacts) of the confirmed cases to stay at home for 5 days after the onset of symptoms (of the confirmed case) and to pay attention to their state of health, and to go into self-isolation if symptoms occur.
Health professionals who had unprotected contact (professional or private) with a confirmed case  continue to work, always wear a surgical mask, ensure perfect hand hygiene and monitor their health.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases guidelines (valid from March 9th) for symptomatic persons and their contacts:
Persons with symptoms of an acute respiratory illness (fever and cough):
 Stay at home for up to 24 hours after the symptoms have subsided (self-isolation)
 Only call a doctor if Your state of health requires this:
   - If the risk of complications is increased (particularly at risk) 
   - in case of dyspnoea
   - if respiratory symptoms worsen
Your close contact persons (people living in the same household, intimate contacts) are instructed to pay attention to their state of health so that they can go into self-isolation as soon as they develop symptoms.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On March 10th, the Jura canton in Switzerland issue new guidelines in relation to quarantine for COVID-19 cases.

If health condition allows it, positive cases have to isolate at home. Isolation ends 48 hours after symptoms disappear. 

If the case is severe, the patient will be hospitalized. The patient will return home whenever their state allows it and isolation ends 48 hours after symptoms disappear.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
On March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases guidelines for dealing with confirmed cases from March 9, 2020 and an information sheet (March 7): What to do if you are infected with the new Coronavirus.
confirmed cases are isolated:
  At home, if the general condition permits (self-isolation)
Removal of isolation: 48 hours after the symptoms have subsided, provided that at least 10 days have passed since the onset of symptoms
  In severe cases in the hospital:
 Return home as soon as the clinical condition permits, or removal of isolation in the hospital in accordance with the criteria listed above. UPDATE: On March 19, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health released new guidelines for isolation of symptomatic persons and quarantine of contact persons.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases guidelines (valid from March 9th) for symptomatic persons and their contacts:
Persons with symptoms of an acute respiratory illness (fever and cough):
 Stay at home for up to 24 hours after the symptoms have subsided (self-isolation)
 Only call a doctor if Your state of health requires this:
   - If the risk of complications is increased (particularly at risk) 
   - in case of dyspnoea
   - if respiratory symptoms worsen
Your close contact persons (people living in the same household, intimate contacts) are instructed to pay attention to their state of health so that they can go into self-isolation as soon as they develop symptoms.
 UPDATE: On March 19, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health released new guidelines for isolation of symptomatic persons and quarantine of contact persons.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases recommendations ( valid from March 9th) for persons who had close contact with someone tested positive for the coronavirus.
Hospital doctors and doctors in private practice instruct the close contact persons (people living in the same household, intimate contacts) of the confirmed cases to stay at home for 5 days after the onset of symptoms (of the confirmed case) and to pay attention to their state of health, and to go into self-isolation if symptoms occur.
Health professionals who had unprotected contact with a confirmed case (professional or private) continue to work, always wear a surgical mask, ensure perfect hand hygiene and monitor their health. UPDATE: On March 19, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health released new guidelines for isolation of symptomatic persons and quarantine of contact persons.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On March 19, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases new guidelines how to deal with symptomatic persons ( Isolation): The sharp rise in COVID-19 cases in Switzerland increases the likelihood that a person with a respiratory disease has contracted the new coronavirus. Persons who have symptoms of an acute respiratory infection, which might be caused by the new coronavirus (SARS- CoV-2) or persons whose disease has been confirmed by laboratory diagnostics do not need to be hospitalized if their general condition is good. They must be isolated at home for at least 48 hours after the symptoms have subsided, provided that at least 10 days have passed since the symptoms began.
This applies to persons with:  Cough, sore throat, shortness of breath, with or without fever, feverish feeling, muscle pain, whether tested or not.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: On March 19, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases new self-quarantine guidelines for persons who have had contact with a sick person: If you live with, or have had an intimate relationship with, someone who has symptoms of acute respiratory disease, you must quarantine yourself at home for 10 days. Stay home for 10 days. The 10 days begin from the time the sick person is isolated. If after 10 days you have no symptoms, you can go public again. This applies if they had contact while the sick person was having symptoms and / or 24 hours before the symptoms appeared.      Monitor your health: Feeling unwell, tired, fever, feverish feeling, cough, sore throat and shortness of breath can be signs of infection with the new coronavirus, among other things.   If Symptoms Occur: Be in self-isolation and follow the instructions that apply to self-isolation.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description:
On April 16, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases a new information sheet for symptomatic persons ( Isolation): The increase in COVID-19 cases in Switzerland has increased the likelihood that a person with a respiratory disease has contracted the new coronavirus. You have symptoms of an acute respiratory infection and / or a sudden loss of smell and / or taste, which may be caused by the new coronavirus or the disease has been confirmed by laboratory diagnostics. If you do not have to be hospitalized as your general condition is good, you must immediately isolate yourself at home for at least 10 days.  End of isolation at home  48 hours after the symptoms have subsided, provided that at least 10 days have passed since the symptoms began. If you have had a sudden loss of smell and taste: it may take longer for the smell and taste buds to recover. The isolation can therefore be lifted if the loss of the sense of smell and / or taste is the only symptom that persists after this time.
This applies to persons with:  sudden loss of smell / taste, cough, sore throat, shortness of breath, with or without fever, feverish feeling, muscle pain, whether tested or not.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description:
The list of countries considered as risk countries was updated on 23 July 2020 by the Swiss Government. From July 6th on all persons who enter Switzerland and who have been in a high risk country within the last 14 days have to quarantine for 10 days. They have to report to the cantonal authorities that carry out spot checks. Contact details are provided by flights or bus services selected at random. Quarantined persons do not get loss of earnings compensation. Non - compliance can be fined.
Excepted are persons who
professionally transport people or goods across borders
whose activity is necessary the functionality of the health system, public security or some international institutions
have stayed in a risk country in the course of their professional activity in companies involved in rail, bus, ship or air transport 
have to travel to Switzerland daily or up to 5 days for occupational or medical necessities
transit passengers

description:
The list of countries considered as risk countries was updated on 23 July 2020 by the Swiss Government. From July 6th on all persons who enter Switzerland and who have been in a high risk country within the last 14 days have to quarantine for 10 days. They have to report to the cantonal authorities that carry out spot checks. Contact details are provided by flights or bus services selected at random. Quarantined persons do not get loss of earnings compensation. Non - compliance can be fined.
Excepted are persons who
professionally transport people or goods across borders
whose activity is necessary the functionality of the health system, public security or some international institutions
have stayed in a risk country in the course of their professional activity in companies involved in rail, bus, ship or air transport 
have to travel to Switzerland daily or up to 5 days for occupational or medical necessities
transit passengers

description: On 24 July, the canton of Bern, Switzerland, requires all 350 persons who attended the Kapitel Bollwerk club in Bern on 18 July and 19 July to go into a 10 day quarantine due to the coronavirus spreading among club visitors.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: On July 29, the Swiss Canton Grisons warns parents against the simple transmission of the virus. It is therefore strongly advised to keep children with symptoms such as runny nose, fever, cough, sore throat, etc. at home and to consult a doctor. Under no circumstances should children and young people take part in holiday and group offers - such as holiday camps, holiday passes or the like - if there are signs of illness. The policy aims to prevent other people from being infected.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On 31 July, the canton of Bern, Switzerland, announces that a participant at an equestrian event on 25 and 26 July has tested positive for corona. The announcement urges anyone with symptoms to quarantine themselves.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
On August 8, 2020 the Swiss FOPH updated the list of considered risk countries. As before (since July 6th) all persons entering Switzerland coming from a risk country have to quarantine for 10 days at home or in a suitable accomodation, a negative test result does not exempt from the mandatory quarantine requirement. They have to report to the cantonal authorities that carry out spot checks. Contact details are provided by flights or bus services selected at random. Exempted are transport professionals, transit passengers, cross border commuter, professionals needed in health system, public security, in some international institutions.

description: On September 25th, 2020 the list of considered risk countries (valid from Sept 28th) was updated by the Swiss FOPH. As before all persons entering Switzerland having stayed in a risk country within the last 10 days have to quarantine for 10 days ( at home or in a suitable accomodation). A negative test result does not exempt from the mandatory quarantine requirement. Quarantined persons do not get loss of earnings compensation (except change of list after departure). They have to report to the cantonal authorities that carry out spot checks. Exempted are diplomats, transport professionals, transit passengers, cross border commuter, professionals needed in health system, public security, in some international institutions and  professionals re-entering after participating in an event like sports competition, cultural event, a specialist congress. risk countries as of September 28th: Albania, Andorra, Argentina, Armenia, Bahamas, Bahrain, Belgium, Belize, Bolivia, Bosnia Herzegovina, Brazil, Cabo Verde, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, Croatia, Czechia, Denmark, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, Guyana, Honduras, Hungary, Iceland, India, Iraq, Ireland, Israel, Jamaica, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Luxemburg, Maledives, Malta, Moldova, Monaco, Montenegro, Morocco, Namibia, Nepal, Netherlands, North Macedonia, Palestine, Oman, Panama, Paraguay, Peru, Portugal, Qatar, Romania, Spain, Slovenia, Suriname, Trinidad and Tobago, Ukraine, UAE, UK, USA.

description:
On March 1, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Basel Landschaft the Government Council ordered a temporary ban on serving drinks and food in Liestal and Sissach from March 1, 7 pm until the next day March 2, 2020 6 am. The permit for restaurants and bars for extended opening times (carnival) are cancelled. Selling of alcolhol is prohibited.
Non compliance can be fined.

description:
At its meeting on March 6th, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council adjusted its strategy. The FOPH has issued recommendations for the world of work: 
- Ensuring consistent compliance with personal hygiene measures (hand washing).
- Employees should, if operationally possible, keep their distance from one another e.g. by creating spatial adjustments, office splitting, teleworking / home office, etc. Masks are not recommended.
- Goodwill should apply when a doctor's certificate is requested. It should be requested from the 5th day at the earliest.
- Employers should make their employees' working hours as flexible as possible so that peak times in public transport can be avoided.
- Employees are to be informed of personal and workplace-related protective measures according to the current guidelines of the FOPH.
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified businesses
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
At its meeting on March 6th, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council adjusted its strategy and focused on protecting particularly vulnerable people. The FOPH has issued recommendations for the working world: Absence from the workplace i.e. home-office should be considered if no distancing or other temporary employment is possible for particularly vulnerable people who are exposed to an increased risk of infection in the workplace.
Risk factors are: above 65 years of age, hypertension, diabetes, cardiovascular disease, chronic respiratory disease, an immune system weakened by disease or treatment, or cancer
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified businesses
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: At its meeting on March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council adjusted its strategy. description:
On March 15th, the Jura canton in Switzerland announced the closure of all non-essential (walk-in) businesses, effective on March 16th.
Essential businesses are allowed to remain open and are defined as the following: any shop that mostly sells essential goods, gas stations and associated shops, kiosks, newsstands, pharmacies, drugstores, pharmacies, banks and post offices. 

Exceptions are the following:
Non-essential businesses that are closed are allowed to receive some clients with appointments. 
Restaurants, shops and institutions are allowed to produce and distribute food that is meant for take away or delivery.

description:
On March 15, 2020 in Switzerland the goverment council of Canton Basel Landschaft  announced that sales outlets that do not serve the maintenance of basic supply (such as food, pet food, medicines, medical aids, fuel) shall be closed starting March 16 till April 30.
Areas that do not serve the basic supply are to be demarcated from the permitted sales areas and closed. Restaurant and hotel businesses and all entertainment venues such as concert halls, cinemas, theaters, museums, sports facilities, fitness centers, swimming pools, discos, bars, nightclubs, erotic clubs, etc. will be required to cease operations.
Non compliance will be fined.

description:
On March 16, 2020 in Switzerland the State Council of Canton Valais announced the closure of following non- essential business starting the same day 6.30 pm:
- all food service establishments, including restaurants, pubs, ice cream parlors, tea rooms, farm vacations, mountain lodges and cabins, occasional opening breweries, bars (including those attached to bakeries, gas stations, train stations, hotels and campgrounds), with the exception of  delivery services/take- away and of non public canteens.
- stores, shops and markets to the public, except those selling food or goods for basic needs, medical and health items, as well as pharmacies, drugstores, opticians, kiosks and gas stations.
- hairdressers, barbers, beauty salons, nail salons, tattoo parlors - including those working at home
The announced hotel closure ( set to start March 17) was revoked when the federal council declared hotels to be essential on March 16 afternoon.

institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On March 15, 2020 in Switzerland the goverment council of Canton Basel Landschaft  announced that in retail outlets selling basic supply  (such as food, pet food, medicines, medical aids, fuel) and service establishments still open to the public, those responsible are required to ensure compliance with the hygiene rules of the FOPH and the social distance. The announced hotel closure ( set to start March 17) was revoked when the federal council declared hotels to be essential on March 16 afternoon. UPDATE: This policy ended March 16, 2020 midnight 12 pm when it got overruled by the federal closure of all non- essential business.

description:
On March 16, 2020 in Switzerland the State Council of Canton Valais announced the closure of following non- essential business starting the same day 6.30 pm:
- all food service establishments, including restaurants, pubs, ice cream parlors, tea rooms, farm vacations, mountain lodges and cabins, occasional opening breweries, bars (including those attached to bakeries, gas stations, train stations, hotels and campgrounds), with the exception of  delivery services/take- away and of non public canteens.
- stores, shops and markets to the public, except those selling food or goods for basic needs, medical and health items, as well as pharmacies, drugstores, opticians, kiosks and gas stations.
- hairdressers, barbers, beauty salons, nail salons, tattoo parlors - including those working at home
The announced hotel closure ( set to start March 17) was revoked when the federal council declared hotels to be essential on March 16 afternoon. UPDATE: This policy ended March 16, 2020 midnight 12 pm when it got overruled by the federal closure of all non- essential business.

description:
On March 15, 2020 in Switzerland the goverment council of Canton Basel Landschaft  announced that sales outlets that do not serve the maintenance of basic supply (such as food, pet food, medicines, medical aids, fuel) shall be closed starting March 16 till April 30.
Areas that do not serve the basic supply are to be demarcated from the permitted sales areas and closed. Restaurant and hotel businesses and all entertainment venues such as concert halls, cinemas, theaters, museums, sports facilities, fitness centers, swimming pools, discos, bars, nightclubs, erotic clubs, etc. will be required to cease operations.
Non compliance will be fined.


 UPDATE: On March 17, this policy was suspended when the federal government closed non essential business by emergency ordinance, but allowed hotels to stay open. The cantonal council adopted its decision.

description: On March 15, 2020 in Switzerland the goverment council of Canton Basel Landschaft  announced that in retail outlets selling basic supply  (such as food, pet food, medicines, medical aids, fuel) and service establishments still open to the public, those responsible are required to ensure compliance with the hygiene rules of the FOPH and the social distance. The number of customers is to be limited to 1 person per 4 squaremeter net sales area. UPDATE: On March 17 the decision of the Government Council was repealed due to a change in the federal Covid19- ordinance 2  (starting March 17).

description:
The Swiss Federal council announces an extraordinary situation whereby all non-essential businesses must close by midnight on March 16th 2020 until April 19th. This policy was extended by one week till April 26th.
The Swiss federal council announced on April 16th a three-phase plan to re-open non-essential businesses starting on April 27th, followed by May 11th and ending on June 8th provided further decreasing case numbers.

description:
On March 16, 2020 at its extraordinary meeting the SwissFederal Council took the decision to introduce more stringent measures to protect the public. 
People at especially high risk should work from home. If that is not possible, they are to be placed on leave by their employers, but will continue to receive their pay. Employees make a personal statement about their particular risk. The employer can request a medical certificate.
risk factors issued by the FOPH are: above 65 years of age, hypertension, diabetes, cardiovascular disease, chronic respiratory disease, an immune system weakened by disease or treatment, or cancer UPDATE: First employees belonging to a vulnerable group should work from home. Now they have to work from home and if that is not possible, they are to be placed on leave by their employers,
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified businesses
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

On March 18, 2020 the Federal Office of Health in Switzerland published guidelines on social distancing and hygiene for essential businesses that remain open after the closing of non-essential businesses on March 17:

- daily cleaning of handles and touched surfaces
- limiting the number of persons (customers and employees) to one person per 10 squaremeter





.

description: At its meeting on March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council adjusted its strategy. The FOPH has issued recommendations for the working world, which should be implemented from March 9: Among other things, working from home i.e. home office is recommended so that all employees can keep their distance if operationally feasible. UPDATE: On March 19, 2020 the FOPH issued new guidlines regarding protection of employees and strongly advises people to work from home. Where possible, employers should allow and facilitate home office.

description:
On 15th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel ordered the closure of all businesses, except those providing essential goods and services, until 30th April 2020. On 23rd March 2020, the Canton abrogated the order which comprised this policy, thus ending it earlier than expected.

NB: this abrogation is probably related to the federal order closing all non-essential businesses on 16th March 2020 (following the declaration of "extraordinary situation"). UPDATE: The original closure of all non-essential businesses was set to last until 30th April 2020, but the Neuchtel state council abrogated the order which comprised this policy on 23rd March 2020.

description: Switzerland, Geneva -- In response to the crisis caused by the coronavirus, the Department of Economic Development (DDE) is encouraging Geneva restaurants and businesses to develop their offer on the Internet, in order to ensure the supply of the population. As of 25 March, 2020, the DDE has released 100,000 francs to speed up the posting of menus for Geneva restaurants and access to home meal delivery services. This aid is paid in installments to the Socit des Cafetiers, Restaurateurs et Hteliers de Genve (SCRHG), which coordinates the distribution of funds. A fund of 50,000 francs has been allocated to the NODE (Nouvelle Organization Des Entrepreneurs), to strengthen the capacity of local e-commerce platforms to process new requests for integration into their website and thus rapidly increase the number of businesses and products available on the Internet.
type_sub_cat: Restaurants
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On April 1, the COVID-19 leadership body (KFO) of the Swiss Canton of Fribourg announced that the selling of seeds, saplings, and potting soil would be allowed under restrictions. These include to online-sales with delivery, drive-in systems with strict distancing and without causing traffic disruption, the closure of access to stores and greenhouses, mandatory orders in advance (online, via telephone or email), the avoidance of payments by cash, and the arrangement of exact timings to pick up the product. This measures eases the federal restriction of non-essential businesses from the 13 March 2020 due to the demand among the population.

description: On April 9, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg allowed the re-opening of markt stalls in public places under the following conditions: The measure only concerns stalls that sell groceries, the distance between stalls in public places needs to be between 50-80 meters, the staff needs to ensure physical distancing of 2 meters in the queue, municipalities decide the days when market stalls are allowed while usual opening times can be extended to reduce the numbers of customers, municipalities need to ensure fair treatment of all merchants, and the cantonal police will be controlling. When these conditions apply, market stalls can only be opened in places where usually markets take place regularly.

description:
On 24th April 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchtel announced a series of requirements for the partial reopening of businesses (scheduled by the Swiss Federal Council on 27th April 2020 - see the policy coded on the federal level). Businesses allowed to reopen have to define a protection scheme for clients and personnel in compliance with the federal recommendations. The scheme has to encompass hygiene and social distancing rules as well as protection for vulnerable populations. Controls will be conducted to ensure compliance with requirements. If the protection scheme is deemed insufficient, cantonal authorities can prevent a business to reopen. If a business doesn't comply with its protection scheme, cantonal authorities can force a business to close.

NB: the businesses allowed to reopen (according to the federal policy) are: personal grooming stores (hair salons, tattoo salons...), hardware stores, florists, garden centers and self-service businesses (carwash, plant nurseries...).
type_sub_cat: Personal Grooming Businesses (e.g. hair salons)
institution_status: This type of business  ("Personal Grooming Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
In Switzerland on April 16, 2020 the Federal Council announced that as of April 27 following non-essential business will be allowed to reopen:
personal grooming ( hairdresser, massage studios, tattoo studios); garden center, florists and nurseries; Do-it-yourself shops; self-service facilities ( car-washing, solarium, pick-your-own-crops).
All business have to follow a protection protocoll including hygienic measures, hand sanitation for customers, allowing social distancing. For personal grooming masks are obligatory, in shops not more than one customer per 10 qm is allowed.

description:
In Switzerland on April 16, 2020 the Federal Council announced that as of April 27 following non-essential business will be allowed to reopen:
personal grooming ( hairdresser, massage studios, tattoo studios); garden center, florists and nurseries; Do-it-yourself shops; self-service facilities ( car-washing, solarium, pick-your-own-crops).
All business have to follow a protection protocoll including hygienic measures, hand sanitation for customers, allowing social distancing. For personal grooming masks are obligatory, in shops not more than one customer per 10 qm is allowed.

description:
On April 29, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council announced the second step of easing business restrictions starting May 11. 
All shops, retail business and markets are allowed to reopen according to their protection concept ( one customers per 10 qm, compliance to the guidelines of the Federal Office of Health in regard of social distancing, hygiene).
Private museum and private libraries may open according to their protection concept.
Restaurants and bars can take the first step of resumption: only for seated consumption, groups of up to 4 per table, distance between tables, closure from midnight to 6 am, no live musik or events, masks recommended for employees

description: On May 12ve, 2020 the government council of Swiss canton Basel City is temporarily allowing Basel restaurateurs affected by the measures against the coronavirus to expand their existing outdoor seating. The expansion is possible immediately without a permit, as long as it meets the requirements (access for fire brigade, police...) and in particular the safety regulations. Expansions on the carriageway or on streets without sidewalks must be reported to the administration.The regulation applies until the distance rules are lifted due to the coronavirus, at the latest until November 15, 2020.

description:
On May 27, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council is easing most of the remaining business restrictions as of 6 June. 
All leisure and entertainment businesses such as casinos, amusement parks, cinema, theatre, discos may reopen, as can swimming pools and spas. Strip clubs may also reopen and services offered by sex workers may resume. Hygiene and social distancing rules must still be observed. If it is not possible to respect social distancing rules, contact tracing must be assured, e.g.by means of attendance lists.
For groups of more than four people restaurants it is required to take the contact details of one guest per table.Customers may still only be served when seated. All establishments, discos and nightclubs are required to close at midnight and may not admit more than 300 people a night. Discos are limited to one customer per 4 qm.
.
type_sub_cat: Restaurants
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description: On June 19, the Federal Council of Switzerland announces that from June 22 until September 13 operators of publicly accessible establishments and businesses such as restaurants, bars, clubs and discotheques and dance venues must draw up and implement a precautionary measures plan. It must include measures relating to hygiene and social distancing. The following persons are exempted from maintaining the required distance of 1,5m: groups of pupils, families or persons of the same household. Otherwise guests have to wear a mask or other effective protective measures must be taken, such as erecting suitable barriers. In the case of seats arranged in rows or in a similar way, in particular in theatres, concert halls and cinemas, only every second seat or seats separated by an equivalent distance may be occupied. The contact details of the persons present must be recorded if it is possible that they will be unable to maintain the required distance for a period in excess of 15 minutes and other protective measures are not in place. The contact details must on request be passed on to the competent cantonal authority or organization for the purpose of identifying and notifying persons who may have been infected. If over 300 persons and a maximum of 1000 persons are present, they must be split into groups of 300 persons per sector. Violation will be punished by fines.
type_sub_cat: Restaurants

description: On June 19, the Federal Council of Switzerland announces that from June 22 until September 13 operators of publicly accessible establishments and businesses such as restaurants, bars, clubs and discotheques and dance venues must draw up and implement a precautionary measures plan. It must include measures relating to hygiene and social distancing. The following persons are exempted from maintaining the required distance of 1,5m: groups of pupils, families or persons of the same household. Otherwise guests have to wear a mask or other effective protective measures must be taken, such as erecting suitable barriers. In the case of seats arranged in rows or in a similar way, in particular in theatres, concert halls and cinemas, only every second seat or seats separated by an equivalent distance may be occupied. The contact details of the persons present must be recorded if it is possible that they will be unable to maintain the required distance for a period in excess of 15 minutes and other protective measures are not in place. The contact details must on request be passed on to the competent cantonal authority or organization for the purpose of identifying and notifying persons who may have been infected. If over 300 persons and a maximum of 1000 persons are present, they must be split into groups of 300 persons per sector. Violation will be punished by fines.
type_sub_cat: Bars
institution_status: This type of business  ("Bars") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: At its meeting on March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council adjusted its strategy. The FOPH has issued recommendations for the working world, which should be implemented from March 9: Among other things, working from home i.e. home office is recommended so that all employees can keep their distance if operationally feasible. UPDATE: At its meeting on June 19, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council lifted its recommendation to work from home in light of persistently low Covid-19 caseloads. The decision as to whether staff should work from home or return to the office is now one for employers as of June 22.

description:
On July 3, 2020 in Switzerland the Health Directorate of canton of Basel-Landschaft requires clubs and bars to verify the accuracy of the visitor data collected by means of control of the identity card starting July 6, 6pm untill further notice.
The decree applies to those catering establishments in which consumption regularly takes place at least partially standing, as seating is only available for a certain number of people, or in which there is the possibility of dancing ( clubs and bars).
It does not apply to restaurant establishments in which consumption is generally done while seated at a table.
Non - compliance can be fined and may lead to the closure of the establishment.

description:
On July 2nd, 2020 the government council of Swiss Canton Basel-City decided to hold the operators and organizers of facilities and events more accountable.They must now ensure the correctness of the collected visitor data by checking the identity card or in another way. A corresponding ordinance on additional measures will come into force on Monday, July 6, 2020 and will apply until December 31, 2020. 
This applies to all situation when according to the federal ordinance contact data are to be collected ( if  social distancing or the wearing of masks is not guaranteed), except for small groups sitting at one table in restaurants if the distance between the tables is large enough.
Non-compliance can be fined.

description: On July 8, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Basel Landschaft announced that starting July 9 till August 31 in clubs or bars where consumption does not take place exclusively in a seated position at a fixed seat, the maximum number of guests shall be limited to 100 persons. Several spatially separated guest areas with a maximum of 100 persons may be operated. The contact data ( in accordance with the federal Covid-19-Ordinance special situation) must be collected for each area individually. Outside these guest areas, if there is a possibility of mixing, either the minimum distance must be maintained or a protective mask must be worn. This applies to outdoor spaces as well.

description: On July 10, the canton of Bern, Switzerland, tightens the rules for registering guests to clubs and bars so that contact tracing is guaranteed in case of an infection. Business owners of bars, clubs, and dance halls, are required to report the name and address of their establishment to the cantonal medical office, including three additional contact persons. Before admission, guests are required to register with their full name, address, phone number, and email addresses with proof of identity. Business owners/contact persons must be available between 7-10am and ensure that the electronic guest list is sent to the cantonal medical office on request.

description:
On 10 Juli the Regierungsrat Kanton Zug decided to add the following restrictions to the national measures: In the interiors of restaurants, including bars and clubs as well as discotheques and dance halls, a maximum of 30 guests may be present at any one time. In the entire guest area of these establishments, including any outdoor areas, a maximum of 100 guests may be present at any one time. The outdoor areas must be clearly recognisable or marked. The contact data must be recorded, regardless of whether the guests enter the interior of the holding or stay only in outside areas ten. 
The decision shall enter into force on 13 July and is in force until 31 August.

description: As of Tuesday July 28 in Geneva, Switzerland, customers must wear a mask in shops, as well as by staff when the latter cannot benefit from another protection system (eg glass or plexiglass). The managers of facilities and establishments open to the public must, from Tuesday July 28, 2020, provide their customers with a hydro-alcoholic solution. description:
From July 31 2020 in Geneva, Switzerland, Customers in bars and restaurants must consume while remaining seated. Interpersonal distances must be respected. This measure is required until 23 August 2020 inclusive and may be extended depending on the epidemiological evolution.

The compulsory mask is now extended to customers of restaurants and bars (including on the terraces) during any movement in the space of the establishment, including for take-out. The client can remove his mask as soon as he is seated.

The operators of bars and similar establishments have the obligation to collect the identity and a reliable means of contact of the customers. 

Violation of these measures may be punished with a fine.

description:
On August 20, 2020 the Government Council of Swiss Canton Basel City decided to make wearing a mask compulsory effective Monday August 24th till December 31 for all publicly accessible indoor areas in sales outlets and shopping centers as well as for the service staff of restaurants and bars.
This does not apply to children under the age of 12 or employees protected by a plexiglass pane. First and foremost, certified or compliant masks are recommended. Scarves or other non-specific textiles are not face masks in the present sense.
Business operator can be fined for non- compliance.

description:
On July 8, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Basel Landschaft announced that starting July 9 till August 31 in clubs or bars where consumption does not take place exclusively in a seated position at a fixed seat, the maximum number of guests shall be limited to 100 persons. Several spatially separated guest areas with a maximum of 100 persons may be operated. The contact data ( in accordance with the federal Covid-19-Ordinance special situation) must be collected for each area individually. Outside these guest areas, if there is a possibility of mixing, either the minimum distance must be maintained or a protective mask must be worn. This applies to outdoor spaces as well.
 UPDATE: On August 17, 2020, the Canton of Basel-Landschaft announced the extension of the limit of the maximum number of customers in bars and clubs to 100 until September 30. (General decree no. 4).

description: On October 16, 2020 the goverment of the Swiss Canton Grisons announced that masks will be mandatory in "public facilities" for all persons over the age of 12, starting October 17, 2020. Shops, shopping centers, post offices, museums, theaters, administrative buildings, places of worship and religious common rooms, cinemas, train stations, libraries, hotels, restaurants are affected by this measure. In restaurants (including bars, clubs, discos etc.) masks only can be taken off, when you are sitting at a table. Only sport and fitness facilites and occuring persons like artists or athletes are excluded from this measure.

description: On March 17, 2020 in Switzerland the Government Council of Canton Basel City restricted the use of  public parks, green spaces, squares and the banks of the Rhine. The control of the coronavirus requires everyone to keep their distance from each other, even outdoors. Everyone is urged not to stay for a long time in the recreational areas with large public traffic. Conducting picnics and barbecues is prohibited. Walking or jogging is allowed in the recreation areas. Children with their caregivers may stay in playgrounds. If everyone is considerate of these rules, the parks and public green spaces can remain open.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Beaches
institution_status: This service provided by the government is provided with conditions atttached
